He gleefully displays products for dozens of franchises, awkwardly shouts about the famous actors that have shown up for cameos, and looks generally more like Mike Myers in odd clothing than a fictional character. There was something about the original character as compared to this new, pseudo-self obsessive Michael Myers that made the whole 60s british swinger character original and hilarious. Dr. Evil and Austin Powers were JUST as hilarious. Now we have seen a disgusting degeration of talent. I felt raped by this movie. I felt ripped off, and I think Michael Myers owes me $6. He didn't have the right to do this to me. I can't get back those two hours I spent in front of that product placement laden feces party. The new character, Goldmember, is disgusting, offensive and disturbing. It is Myers trying to force humour from a situation that does not warrant any. Enough said. This is a shudderingly awful travesty of a film, and should never have been made. Take me seriously, it's a waste of your time.

Please wake me when Mike Myers acquires a little integrity and puts this bow-wow of a series to sleep. All the ingenuity that was in the original (and Dr Evil WAS one of the great comic inventions of the decade) has by this sequel to a sequel to a parody dribbled away in a long line of excreta gags. Goldmember's accent is not Dutch; Fat Bastard was never funny; eating flakes of your own skin is not funny; and most movies actually do better when a plot is used. Myers ought to be ashamed but I guess the cash-registers are ringing too loudly for him to hear the little voice in his head saying: "For love of humanity, stop!"

Review title: Not as good as the past two but still as funny as hell!
Review_body: I saw it last night on the opening day. I watched the Austin Powers TRL, I admit. I thought it was hilarious in the beginning. (The movie) I won't say anything because it is so freaking funny! *is cracking up just thinking about it* The crude, bathroom humor doesn't stop throughout the movie but I was laughing/cringing/covering my eyes. Fat Bastard is naked. GROSS!!!! Beyonce acts really well as the sexy Foxxy Cleopatra, and Verne Troyer as Mini-Me is hilarious. Goldmember is absolutely hilarious and disgusting. Scott Evil is slowly turning evil. Spoofing You Only Live Twice and Goldfinger mercilessly throughout the movie, it has a totally unbelievable ending that shocked the whole theater. Out of five stars I give it a 3.

Review title: A crued, childish mixture of re-gurgitated stupidity
Review_body: When I went to see the long awaited Austin Powers 3 I didnt hold my hopes high due to the sequel 'The Spy Who Shagged Me' being miles from its predossessor.  What we get with the movie 'Goldmember' is the same re-hashed humour that seems almost to mock the deformed or different.  The first half hour of this farsy third installment comprises of Miss Beyonce Knowles' pretty damb appalling portrayal of Foxxy Cleopatra whpse character by no means adds to the plot.  Believe me theres no one sexier than Beyonce Knowles but I would keep on singing baby, for you may be a whole lotta woman but I dont rekon a whole lot to your acting skills.Apart from that 25 minutes seems to be comprised of a joke about a mole, which only the demented people at the back even remotely found interesting and well a mole. Thats your lot.Even though the films first 30 minutes werent enough to keep the joker laughing the movies main star  'Mini Me' seems to be the main part of the humour.  Whereas Mike Myers Mindless character 'Goldmember' seems as almost pointless as Beyonce Knowles..but as least shes sexy.Jay Roach should be really dissapointed, in the light of his film 'Meet the Parents' which was the best comedy so far 'Goldmember' seems like another ploy for Jamie Lee Curtis stalker Mike Myers to return and kill us with his 'make more cash, crappy characters.In many ways it seems the movie 'Goldmember' is just a chance for  few actors to mess around and hopefully an audience will fall for the same prosessed humour that was seenback in the original movie.All in all Goldmember is a film that delivers few humourous moments but manages to stimulate one small part of the brain.  With cameos from Tom Cruise and Kevin Spacey its worth the watch, if not just to see foxxy beyonce in one of her sexy outfits!

Although the original Austin Powers is still the best of the series, Goldmember is strong as a comedy and it's certainly better than "The Spy Who Shagged Me." Mike Myers is one of the most creative comic writers of today and eventhough the jokes are crude, each one is inventive because Myers is having so much fun with his characters and the material. Goldmember is not heavy on plot, but we're not supposed to care if it's story is weak. Audiences should sit back and enjoy all the lunacy and fun, because after all this picture is a treat. Goldmember is a better movie than the second installment because the characters are more interesting this third time around, and I feel as though Myers is not trying too hard to make us laugh as he did with "The Spy Who Shagged Me." Myers has so much fun making this series that I'm confident that the fourth picture will be successful as a film.

Review title: Weakest In The Series,But Still Halirious
Review_body: This movie is the worst of all the Austin Powers,but its still pretty good.i wont spoil anything but the beginning is really great.the movie has great and hilarious  cameos.it does get really dumb at some points but theres are times where you can't stop laughing.also if your a Mini Me fan your going to love this movie because he plays such a bigger role.Goldmemeber the character was extremely annoying and i hated him,as I'm sure you will too.but other characters such as the Mole are really funny and Foxy Cleopatra is actually a pretty good character,and very beautiful.if you enjoyed the other Austin Powers than you should really see this one.you won't be disappointed.

Don't get me wrong.  I love Mike Myers, Austin, Dr. Evil (especially) and the whole gang.  This 3rd movie just didn't seem to have the same vim and vigor the other two did.  Very very funny but just not with the same energy. That opening sequence was a total surprise and hilarious.  Austin/Mike just didn't seem to be having a fun time making the movie.Dr. Evil was as cute as ever though - purrrrrrrr.

Review title: Some funny bits, and mostly it delivers
Review_body: I thought that one of the cleverest ways to attack this movie is just what Mike Myers did. He made fun of the fact that he was re-using the same jokes over from the last two Austin films. As in the part where he very randomly starts in on Scott for no reason, and Scott's reaction is "Oh wait this is very familiar, let me do what I do". Brilliant. However there are parts in the movie where this concept doesn't carry as well as it does there. The Fat Bastard bits seemed forced, although the wire gag was funny. The shadow puppet bit that was done much better and funnier in the second movie. What saves this movie really from being a re-run is the conflict with Austin's father, and the new villain Goldmember. Michael Caine is excellent and refreshing as Austin's father, although it was almost a little too much drama than I wanted when i pay to see an Austin Powers movie. But Goldmember is spot on. He is hilarious, and the best part about him is he's original! Loved every scene he was in and thought that he was VASTLY underused for having the movie named after him. It was like here's DR. EVIL! DR. EVIL! DR. EVIL! and oh yeah Goldmember, but look over here at DR. EVIL!! Also as a side note I thought that all the good Mini-Me stuff was in the second movie.Quote that I though defined the movie: Ozzy Osbourne saying "These filmmakers are boobs, they are using the same jokes as they did in the last Austin Powers movie."My Personal Favorite: "Dominoes, Mother&#%*!"

Review title: Not as good as #1 and #2, but still very funny.
Review_body:
The third installment of the Austin Powers series is not as funny as either of the first two movies, but it's still worth seeing.  Although the writing in this film is weaker than the first two, and some of the jokes seemed like they were waiting for a final rewrite (or a script doctor), there is still plenty of enough really funny scenes to make it worth.
P.S. Make sure you stick around for the brief out-takes and a short extra material during the credits.

Review title: A classic.. but please, no more AP
Review_body: This is a good film to end the Austin Powers series. Goldmember shines as being the funniest baddie ever, with excellent dialogue and the worst Dutch accent you will ever hear. Michael Caine plays the rogue dad to a tee, but the only let down is Dr. Evil who is cringengly unfunny and has developed a very tedious obsession with Belgium. But overall the sets looks beautiful and all the characters are cute enough in a day-glo, Austin Powers type of way.

This is definetely the worst installment of Austin Powers. It is funny in many parts, but actually gets boring in others. It is very predictable as well. This is a movie you can wait for to go on dvd. The jokes got a little old, but that wasn't the worst of it, they took many of them way too far, which is disasterous.

Review title: A sparsely funny mess not up to par with the first two installments.
Review_body: Wait, isn't the essence of Austin Powers is that it's a spy spoof? I guess not. While The Spy Who Shagged Me still retained a fair amount of spy cliche moments, Goldmember has lost any similarity to the original Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery. In its place are gross-out after gross-out gags, with no sense of timing or cadence to the jokes themselves. A good amount of the jokes themselves are misfires, some are way overdone (the Mole, urine fountain joke), while some just leave you scratching your head (Goldmember himself). Although the opening sequence is funny for the surprises, every other joke that appears was done before in the previous 2 films (curtain screen jokes, fat bastard, Austin/Mini-Me fight, Dr. Evil/Scott Evil interaction, opening dance sequence, music video sequence). Unfortunately, most of these were accomplished more competently in the first 2 installments, and even if they were not, they had the advantage of at least being fresh at the time. Goldmember comes off as just an unoriginal retread and unnecessary sequel that will be seen by many just because it is a "franchise", while ignoring the spirit that made the first movie and much of the second enjoyable.

This movie is a must-see if only for the opening skit. The celebrity cameos are hilarious! The rest of the movie was pretty good, although there was an overuse of toilet humour. One thing that annoyed me was the cameo by the Osbournes; do they have to be in everything? I just don't find them funny. Overall, it's a good movie to see if you just want a laugh.
P.S. Look out for references to Toronto and the Maple Leafs.

Mike Myers is back for his third outing as the international man of mystery, Austin Powers. Sadly though, he should have stopped at "The Spy Who Shagged Me," as the introduction of new but boring characters and the rehashing of already used jokes means that this is nowhere near as funny as the previous two.Admittedly, there are still a few laughs to be had out of this, and the movie is in no way terrible. The acting is spot on, and there could have been no better choice than Beyonce to star as Foxxy Cleopatra. Michael Caine is top notch as always, and Verne Troyer probably got the most laughs out of me as Mini Me.However, the inclusion of Goldmember to the characters played by Mike was a big mistake. He was just not funny at all, lacking character throughout, and is easily forgettable. Some of the jokes used were already done in the previous films, and as such were not funny the second time round, for example, the satellite shaped like a pair of breasts scene was already done in The Spy Who Shagged Me.To conclude, Goldmember is still an enjoyable experience, and the inclusion of cameo appearances from the likes of Kevin Spacey and Danny Devito was well put in, just don't expect to get as many laughs out of this as the last two films.

Review title: So much pop, it will make your teeth rot.
Review_body: This movie was terrible.  It was a constant reminder that Hollywood needs some original ideas.Austin Powers:  Oldmember, err I mean Goldmember, is another chapter in the life of Austin Powers.  (Don't worry, there are no spoilers that will jeopardize the movie).Austin has to hunt down some old gezzer named Goldmember, how original.  Dr. Evil and Goldmember are partners because they want to rule the world, blah blah blah, you get the idea.  This movie had so many pop stars I wanted to kill myself; with talent less silicone infested people like Britney Spears, to the dysfunctional, brainless, prince of stuttering Ozzy Osbourne, this movie was crawling with celebrities that shouldn't even be in the film.  I never did understand why all these celebes were in the movie, was Mike Myers trying to take a page from Moby?  or just to say, "Look, these are my friends."I'm not going to lie, I was so tired of seeing commercial after commercial of Austin Powers, but when I seen the movie, it wasn't all that's cracked up to be, and now I am REALLY tired of seeing these obsolete commercials of Austin Powers.  Well, on a more softer side to Austin Powers, Myers tried to make Austin out to be the victim when his father was never there for him; aahhh, my black heart bleeds for him; the chemistry between Austin and his father does not click with me, it was so dry of a good relationship.Saying Mike Myers is a comic genius is like saying Fred Durst or Kid Rock are brilliant lyricists, it's just not true.  Austin Powers wasn't funny, the acting was terrible, and the characters had the worst dialogue in the world.  Also, what is with the dancing?  Come on, this movie was WORSE than Crossroads, and THAT should tell you something.

Review title: Not half as funny as the first 2
Review_body: It was a bit disappointing. I may be giving an inaccurate account due to the fact I was in the far right first row seats and had a terrible time just sitting there, but I think I'm still somewhat correct. My basic opinion is that the movie was not half as good as the first 2. There wasn't a whole lot of original comedy. Most of the jokes were just jokes about the first 2 movies. In AP1 and 2 I just couldn't stop laughing straight through the movie. This 3rd one I only got a few genuine laughs out of it. That and my neck hurting like hell from my seat location just made me all antsi and I couldn't wait for it to be over.

sorry - this is just poor - I would have walked out but I hadn't driven to the cinema and it was raining. no new jokes. no storyline (not even a hint). Mike Myers you really should know better........

Review title: The opening sequence is a must see. The rest is not.
Review_body: If you loved the other two then go ahead and see it. You should know that this is easily the weakest of the three. The opening sequence is great and should be seen by everyone. The rest of the movie is just a bunch of sketch comedy glued together with an almost non-existent story line.

Thats right, this movie is terrible and not even remotely funny. The truth is that I did not like that much the previous movies but at least they were somewhat funny. This one is just the same things over and over again with some lame attempts of humor.

It was Saturday, I was bored, so I decided to live out the British Spy in me and go see Austin Powers, the first two movies of which I found hilarious and superb.I would have had more fun watching a snail cross the road.Honestly people, maybe it was me, maybe I didn't get the jokes...  but when I went to this movie, I was stunned to find myself holding the popcorn bag to my face, waiting for someone to throw Goldmember off a bridge or something.The Good:  The beginning.  Instant gut-implosion time, woot!The Bad:  Is it just me, or did Doctor Evil totally change facial expressions more than ever?  Also very little Frau and Number 2. Pity.The Ugly:  GOLDMEMBER.  If I saw one more moment of him, that bag would have had more in it than just POPCORN.The only way anyone would ever drag me to that movie again is so that I could see that marvelous Two Towers trailer, and some more Bond. Cool.Final rating:  (1.5/5)  Retire baby, yea!

Review title: It's over, this series has hit bottom....hard
Review_body: I just got back from seeing this one and I have to say this is the first movie this year to completely disappoint me. It's just completely lacking anything to keep you interested. Sure all the people are back and all the jokes are in there that you would expect but it's just not funny this time.Now I expected to see a lot of the same things that were in the first two movies in this series. The Dr. Evil vs Scott game where Scott tries to talk and Dr. Evil tries to make him shut up, The Fat Bastard fixation on bodily functions and excrement jokes, and even the now classic Dr. Evil contacting the "World Government" and asking for a ridiculous amount of money to ransom the world were all right where I expected them to be.I'm not annoyed that they repeated all of this and I don't think that's the reason it wasn't funny this time around. I just think that on every one of the running gags they blew it. None of the actors seemed to be trying very hard and in almost every case the timing was off badly.The story is like some sad rip-off of the second one with less thought put into making it. The opening credits are funnier than anything else in the picture which makes for a really long movie.The girl from Destineys Child might be a hell of a singer but she couldn't act her way out of a paper bag. Mike Meyers Austin character seems really forced and he doesn't look like he's having much fun doing it. His Fat Bastard character doesn't do anything amusing and is completely wasted. The lines he has are just gross without any comedy involved. It's almost like Meyers thought FB could just show up and we would laugh. The whole movie feels this way.Goldmember (the character) doesn't even have a previous funny appearance going for him. He's just gross without a point and if possible less funny than everyone else around him.The first one I didn't think much of when I first saw it but it got funnier with time and after running into it a couple of times I could appreciate it for what it was. Obviously Dr. Evil stole the movie. The second one was better because it focused a lot more on the Dr. Evil character and it seemed clear that Meyers had figured out what people enjoyed about the series. This one looks like it was made so a lot of people could collect checks.

The second I saw the first trailer for Goldmember, I knew that it was going to be extremely stupid, but I was gonna laugh my @$$ off. That being said, this movie lived up to my expectations and more. There hasn't been a time where I laughed so hard at the theaters since the South Park movie came out. There were parts of "Austin Powers in Goldmember" where I laughed so hard, I was crying. Like other reviewers have been saying, the beginning is hilarious, sure the plot is thin but it's a comedy. My friend was complaining about the how the storyline made no sense, but he did laughed at the movie so apparently Mike Myers and Jay Roach did something right. I base my like or dislike of a movie based on whether or not I'm waiting for it to be over. With Goldmember, I was laughing throughout the entire movie and hoped that it wouldn't end. Definitely see it multiple times. It's a laugh riot.10 out of 10

The cameos were good. Beyond that,this one was way too thin on laughs. Mike Meyers should've quit this franchise while he was ahead. I loved the first two Austin Powers movies but I won't be standing in line to see an AP4.

I just saw "Austin Powers in Goldmember" so since it's fresh in my mind, I'll make my comment on it. I give it 8 stars out of 10. It was very funny, it had a few references to the '70s, and not so much the '60s like the first two movies. Dr. Evil finally gets captured and it happens just when he's revealing his latest plot which is to go to 1975 to meet Goldmember, who has invented a successful tracking beam. He code names the plan, "Preparation H". They will use the tracking beam to bring a meteor to Earth to flood the planet. Soon after, Austin's father Nigel Powers is kidnapped and he finds out from Dr. Evil that he must go back to '75 to find Goldmember, who has Nigel. While there he meets his old flame Foxxy Cleopatra who is a detective. They both go back to 2002 after Goldmember goes to 2002 with Nigel and soon they are involved with Goldmember and Dr. Evil's newest plot. They recycled a few jokes from the first two movies like the joke with Austin being behind a sheet with Felicity and it seemed like she was pulling things out of his ass. They also (once again) recycled the joke where Dr. Evil asks the government for $1,000,000. It was very good. Beyoncè's performance was exceptional and Mike Myers once again succeeded in making a great movie. The cameos were great. Britney Spears, Gwyneth Paltrow, Tom Cruise, Kevin Spacey, Danny DeVito, Katie Couric, the Ozzbournes, the list goes on. The only complaint I have is that they never explained what had happened to Felicity Shagwell. I could understand if maybe Heather Graham didn't want to be in the movie, but still, they could've at least given a brief explanation to what happened to her within the movie. Even so, I highly anticipate seeing this again, and I will definintely get it when it comes to video. Also, I do hope that they make an Austin Powers 4.

It's hard to believe how low taste in what passes for "funny" has sunk. Is everyone 8 years old? Is that why these Austin Powers movies are so popular?Mindy Sterling is the only good part of the entire movie and she's not in enough scenes. Where are The Three Stooges when we need them?

!!!SPOILERS!!!This installment of Austin Powers has all the things that made the original great. No plot (almost), celebrity cameo and of course the rude word quick cutting (not in the first, but it was funny). Not the rehash that was 'The Spy Who Sh*gged Me', 'Goldmember' also has the advantage of Micheal Caine's hilarous turn as Austin's father. Meanwhile, two supporting characters (Scott Evil & Mini-Me) get two subplots to chew on and dig that opening (rent it just for that). Worth a rental, or if you are a Powers fan, worth buying.

Review title: BY FAR THE BEST AUSTIN POWERS MOVIE EVER!!
Review_body: A great movie and hilariously funny. Also Minime was great. Another good part is when we saw the apperance of rocker Ozzy Osbourne and his family.  Also there was a funny twist at the end but i wont write about that. Trust me this is one movie youve gotta watch this summer!

Austin Powers 3 was a very good movie and it made me laugh quite a bit, but Mike Myers unfortunately was not able to shine with all of his brilliance in this movie. With it's wonderful new jokes, such as Fred Savage playing the mole for the secret agents, and having a grotesque mole above his lip, makes for outrageous humor when characters interact with him.  The film also, successfully, uses almost all the jokes from the previous two installments in this trilogy.  I mean why not?  If it's funny and makes money, do it right?  That seemed to be Hollywood's only plan.Mike Myers was not allowed to do what he does best, and that is adlib.  His sense of humor is apparent in his writing ability, but it really shines when he pulls jokes and gags out of thin air, and that ambiance is what this movie was seriously lacking. Although it was funny, and I recommend seeing it, I do feel that it is not the greatest of the 3, and falls short where the other two stand strong.

This has got to be the funniest Austin Powers film, if not the best comedy there is. Now it may not suit everybody's taste but just so long as you don't watch it expecting a plot or story that flows, you will have one hell of a laugh! All the old gags are present and they STILL seem to work! Beyonce Knowles is extremely Foxy and the cameos from the likes of Steven Spielberg and Britney Spears are worth every penny. Honestly, watch this film if you love Austin Powers as there is plenty of energy left in the franchise and hopefully enough to keep it going many more years.The only downside to the film is that you can't remember every classic scene and every joke. Still, a good excuse to watch it again!

I liked first two movies - I liked them very much.I had good laugh and I bought video and watch them for few times. Bad. It means that I remember all quotes etc. This third one was like Mike M. was stealing from him self. So sad.

A horrible mix of bad acting, unfunny jokes, a plot that makes the Mario Bros. Movie look like Citizen Kane and some of the rudest and most pointless scenes ever. I saw this movie expecting something funny that would spoof the excellent Bond series but what I got was more how I imagine an adult film to be. You wouldn't know it was supposed to spoof James Bond as nothing Bond-like is present. The characters are boring and remarkable but not in a good way. The jokes are corny and are just vulgar. If you haven't already been cursed by its awfulness then skip this movie at all costs.I recommend this movie to someone that enjoys stuffing their face and then going on fairground rides a million times eventually being sick.

Review title: If you like the series... (spoiler, but NOT really!)
Review_body: Then you'll love the newest Austin Powers movie.  All three times my younger sister and I have gone to see this new flick the opening weekend, and LOVED it.  If you enjoy the series, at all, you'll think the new part(s) hilarious.  If you don't think highly of the previous Power's efforts, ... then skip this one.  Otherwise, you'll say "It was worth the price of admission!"  IF nothing else.  Personally, I thought Goldmember was 2nd all-time to the original... Elizabeth Hurley rules!!!

Review title: "I laughed so hard I wey my pants!"
Review_body: From the hilarious opening to the plot-twisting ending, this movie will make anyone and everyone laugh till your sides ache with pain. With a star-studded cast, this is by far the best comedy, or movie, of the summer.

This was a total waste of $5.50. They are grabbing at straws now and can't come up with jokes or story lines. Not that I even enjoyed the first two. But everything you hated from the first ones is magnified. I know this is just popcorn fodder and mindless teenager BS but the bottom line is it's not funny. I almost fell asleep. Mr. Myers, it's time to move on. So I Married An Axe Murderer was great.

Review title: I liked the second one better...
Review_body: What made the spy who shagged me funny was the fact that it took risks and had new ideas...But I felt as if this addition was too commercialized (SPOILER:  as much as I enjoyed seeing Britney's head explode, it was really an advertisement...I felt like it was saying "Hey kids! Look it's Britney Spears singing her new hit song "Boys!")...There were a lot of funny moments, but I felt kind of disappointed...

Review title: Goldmember is fine, not bad, not beautiful.
Review_body: In the various reviews I've read about Goldmember I see pure fans gulping down the small idiosyncrasies and other foibles in the story.This movie is good.Indeed it isn't as creative, or "new" as the first two films; however, it has the creative and trademarked comedy that can only be found in a film by Mike Myers.Some scatological, some intellectual, other things just Monty Python...the comedy in this film appears to be duplicates of "good" stuff from the first two.The good stuff: The story flows well.  It moves at a pace that keeps one awake and interested.  There are a number of jokes that were so humorous I stopped breathing.  The characters, and the actors behind them, all did very well.The Not-So-Good stuff: Again, sometimes the jokes are just repeats.  But, there's nothing wrong with them.  I LOVE AUSTIN POWER JOKES, seeing repeats of the same jokes is great.  There could have been some more "new" things, but the reuse of older ideas didn't bother me.That's all the bad things I have to say!In general, this is a very good movie.  I sat in a nicely sized audience, and have never heard people laugh so hard.  Why do some of these other reviewers have to be so harsh to the film?This movie is good.

Review title: The 1st Austin Powers movie was great, the 2nd was better, but the 3rd one is the best!
Review_body: Last night I went to see "Goldmember", the newest installment in the hilarious Austin Powers movies.  The theater was packed and almost every seat was filled.  After the opening scene, everyone in the theater was just dying in their seats.  I was, in fact, also.  "Goldmember" is by far the funniest of the 3 Austin Powers movies!  There are some very funny celebrity cameos, but the Osbournes really just need to go away.  The sight gags from the first 2 films are back, and better than ever!  The character Goldmember was very funny, and Fat B*****d is more hilarious in this one, but way more disgusting.  It was also very funny how Austin reacted to the mole on, well The Mole.  And of course Austin and Dr. Evil are very funny.  Don't forget Mini-Me!  Anyone who says this is the worst film of the Austin Powers movies has no sense of humor.  I think a lot of people would agree because everyone in the theater was laughing so hard.  And how could you not like a movie that is making fun of Jay-Z?

Review title: Greatest and Funniest Powers Movie Yet
Review_body: The Austin Power's series just keeps getting better and better. Mike Myers is a great writer who knows what it takes to make his movies better and better. Austin and Dr. Evil are even funnier in this movie, and I think Beyonce Knowles as Foxxy Cleopatra is the best "Powers Girl" so far. Considering this is her first movie she's appeared in, she did a great job. The one thing I didn't like about the movie was Goldmember. I thought his character was soo stupid, but even still I loved the movie.My favorite character in this movie though would have to be Mini-Me. The role he has in the movie is soo funny.*SPOILER* The best part is when Scott finally starts to become evil, and Dr. Evil begins to neglect Mini-Me. Mini-Me then defects and joins forces with Austin Powers, and thats when the movie really starts to get hilarious. Mini-Me dresses up like Austin and the two try to break into Dr. Evil's submarine, and those two together were just hilarious. *END*All in all this in probably the best Austin Powers yet. And the ending is just great. The cameos (Tom Cruise, Kevin Spacey....) at the beginning of the film were great too. You'll love this one. 10/10

Generally, I don't mind silliness if the creator is successful in carrying out his intent, but most of AUSTIN POWERS IN GOLDMEMBER relies on potty humor that takes a great deal of patience to watch after a while.
I liked the cameos with Tom Cruise and Gwyneth Paltrow.  If the movie had continued in the vein they were going, it would have been much more sophisticated.  Mike Myers's versatility in characterization is nothing short of impressive.  His Scottish accent is absolutely amazing; however, you can catch that in SHREK and avoid the scenes in GOLDMEMBER that make you want to vomit.  I'd like to see Myers in some more mature material, à la Blake Edwards.One of the reasons entertainers frequently deign to such crudeness is because this subject material is the type a broader range of his audience will understand.  Now that he has amused those of baser tastes, I challenge Myers to come up with something for his more intelligent fans. Shakespeare proved that you can write to the masses without disgusting others who prefer something more stimulating.

I saw Goldmember on opening night last Friday, and I've been trying to figure out since then why I didn't think it was very good.  Sure, there were some funny scenes, such as one that was reminiscent of the tent scene in Austin Powers 2.  That was hilarious.  So was a fight scene between Austin and Mini-Me.  On the whole, however, this movie was basically a dud.  One classic way of knowing it was a letdown:  about half way through the movie, I noticed that I and the people around me were starting to get all squirmy, which is usually a pretty good indication that a movie doesn't have your complete attention.So what was wrong?  It's hard to say.  Partly, I think it took itself too seriously.  I saw some interviews with a couple of the cast members, including Mike Myers, and they all said how much fun they had making this movie.  It doesn't show on screen.  Nobody really seems to be having that good a time.  In fact, the movie almost has a bit a mean streak in it. There also wasn't much chemistry between Myers and Beyonce Knowles, nothing like what Myers had with Elizabeth Hurley in the original, or with Heather Graham in The Spy Who Shagged Me.  It was almost as if Myers was just tired of doing the whole Austin Powers thing, and couldn't bring himself to really get into character, or the movie.  He doesn't even have the trademark bad teeth throughout most of the film.  Maybe playing 4 roles was just too much for him.As far as recommendations go, if you like the second Austin Powers movie better than the first, you might really like this one.  Personally, I thought the original was by far the best one, much more lighthearted and silly, whereas the second one was a little too vulgar for my liking.  If you disagree, then, like I said, maybe you'll really like Goldmember.  It's a tough call.

It seems that a lot of the comments are jumping on the popularity bandwagon, Goldmember is sparodically funny, but not a patch on the first 2, goldmember himself is just not funny at all, and the cinema i was in, his lines were met with a stoney silence. Once again Dr evil and Mini Me stole the show, but its about time Austin himself was laid to rest.

Goldmember is an outrageously average film, with poor jokes, poor writing and dreadful product placement. Lets face facts, the Austin Powers movies have been average, they ain't no laugh riot. The great thing about the Spy Who Shagged Me was of course, the introduction of Mini-Me. So what could be funnier, than to have this character be hit, fall over and generally be funny to look at. Beyonce Knowles suffers from a dreadful script in which she utters 'sugar' at every given opportunity to prove that she is from the '70s. Goldmember and Fat Bastard are dreadful characters, and the scenes with the 'mole' are extremely painful to watch. As for Dr. Evil and Powers, same old jokes apply of course. Just seems to me the Mike Myers has run out of ideas, and by adding a new character for him to play as the cameos do not hide that this a poor film. Austin Powers fans will love it i'm sure, but this is franchise too many. I'll be interested where Myers goes after this.

When Austin Powers first strode forth, it was a delightful romp with a lot of fond digs at a colourful and unique period of Western Culture.  It was new and imaginative and even a tad reminiscent of the Rank "Carry Ons". Unfortunately with this last effort, Myers uses up all that is imaginative in the first ten minutes.  Fortunately for the cinema going public, the first ten minutes alone is worth the price of the admission!  The rest...well you could get up and leave and retain happy memories of Austin Powers...

Mike Myers, the brilliant comedy mind behind all three "Austin Powers" movies, has finally run out of steam. The jokes fell flat, the plot was too contrived to be cute, and the sight-gags were few and far between. What is onscreen is a mess of skits thrown together to form a not-quite cohesive movie.When walking out of the theater moments ago, my friends and I admitted that there were a few moments that were funny. I said, "the other movies were GREAT, and this one was just okay with a couple of GOOD moments." My friend replied "Mike tried too hard". We all nodded in agreement.He should have stopped after the second installment.

In the third Installment of Mike Myers' Masterpiece AUSTIN POWERS IN GOLDMEMBER. This movie was WAY better than the 2nd, and possibly better that the classic AP movie- the first one.  It has soo much humor, wonderful hilarious cameos, and a great twisted ending. GO SEE GOLDMEMBER!! I saw it the day b4 it came out on a sneak preview and I loved it.  It is the best movie I have seen all summer.  This is definately not one to miss!

Review title: Mike Myers is not a comic genius.
Review_body: After seeing the first two Austin Powers movies which I found funny, I decided to see the third one expecting the same hilarious laughs that I had in watching the previous film The Spy Who Shagged Me. Austin Powers in Goldmember does have some funny moments but a lot of scenes are just recycled jokes from the first two.  The thing that bugged me the most about this film was how Mike Myers resorted to being more and more gross just to get laughs (ie. any scene with Fat Bastard).  He seems to think that bodily fluids and functions are the most hilarious things on earth. He is funny in scenes but is no comic genius like a lot of people are calling him. Another thing that bothered me was a long setup for one line involving "Mr.Roboto". It was not funny and I knew it was coming as soon as I heard the word Roboto.  The bottom line is that Mike Myers can be funny even if most of his humour does involve bodily functions (The Spy Who Shagged Me). But in this film he goes too far and uses too many stale jokes. I give it two stars out of five.

I normally like Mike Myers' movies a lot - funny, sometimes crazy, with more nerve then one can possibly imagine, but this time, I think he tried milking a cash cow just once too often. The jokes are awkward, the plot cliche and just very haphazard. The dialogue is filled with the usual tired risque humor that we have all come to know and love from the Austin Powers persona, but here, they seemed to deliberately act as ridiculous as possible, rehashing old plot threads and playing around with the familiar characters that we've laughed at from the start. In a nutshell, Goldmember is awkward, poorly written and stupendously unfunny.

Although when I walked into the theater I wasn't expecting a very good movie, I was pleasantly surprised.  I'm not a big Beyoncé fan and doubted her acting abilities.  She was fair, and Mike Myers was at his best.  The cameos were great.  This is most certainly the best one yet.  It even has a surprise ending.  The best part was when they showed them as young students and Evan Farmer was there as young Number 2.  You may remember him from the best movie ever made, 2GETHER, he played Jerry.  The cast was great and the story was amazing.  This is a must see.

I just love Mike Myers, I watched all of his movies and I enjoyed watching him in "SNL" too, and I must say the man is brilliant.Austin Powers, the perfect British secret agent, is one of the best ideas Hollywood ever had, The new & improved James Bond! Mike myers did a great job writing the scripts and Jay Roach completes him beautifully by directing every word and every sentence so magically.Mike Myers is undoubtly one of the funniest comidian alive and his sense of humor is enchanting to any sort of viewer.I've seen this movie 3 times and I must say: "no one can make me laugh like that but Myers!"    I warmly suggest you watch this movie I promise you you'll love it.I gave "Goldmember" 10/10, point for each time I cried out of laughter! :)By the way, try watching "Wayne's World" too!

I really didn't know what to expect from this 3rd installment of the Austin Powers franchise. I did expect the line on opening night to be extremely long. Thankfully the wait time I spent was only 1 hr and twenty minutes because I would have killed myself otherwise. I really savored the opening credits for it is something that was completely unexpected. After the opening I had carried over high hopes that the movie be better than watching clothes spin in a dryer...I lost my anticipation as soon as I saw the same "shh" joke from the previous two Austins. Even though most of the jokes were recycled, there were a few scenes that made me open up and blast my drink downward. The storyline seemed to have come from one of those websites that every loser in the world can add a line to the story, twists and stupidity ensues surprises and bad accents. If you liked Austin before, you might like this movie as the trilogy completes, but if you never did like the series, do not waste your time/money on this overrated repeat. Just remember, you don't have to leave the theater right away, go to another one to get your money's worth, since Goldmember is not worth the eight dollars you paid. Popcorn?

Review title: Immensely funny yet not without faults
Review_body: So you're in the theater as the movie begins and you're blown away by what appears to be an all out Austin action adventure.  In the back of your head you know that's not the style of the films prior, so you keep an eye out for a usual gag.  Then you realize you've been hoaxed! Don't know what I mean?  See it for yourself!  It's one of the funniest moments in the movie and I'd like to preserve that for you."Goldmember" is just as funny if not funnier than "The Spy Who Shagged Me" mainly because it slaps you with jokes at unexpected moments as well as the expected ones!  The jokes don't let you down and I guarantee you will laugh. What is a little shabby though is the story line.  Seems the movie wanted to hit your funny bone more than your thirst for knowledge of the Austin Powers world.So while it's storyline isn't quite gold, the comedy's what keeps it getting sold!

Review title: Knowles Shines - Austin Loses Some Glimmer
Review_body: While it has some hilarious moments, Goldmember is more like a series of unconnected scenes than a movie.  Sure, there are laughs for those of us who love the silliness of it, but it was totally disconnected.  Mike Myers was as always funny as Austin, with Beyonce Knowles turning in a surprisingly good performance as Foxxy Cleopatra.  Love Michael Caine, but they should have given him more to do and Fat you-know-who less.  Getting a little tired of Mini-Me, too.  Oh well, it's brain candy, what do you expect?  A fun, silly evening, anyway.  Don't expect much and you'll get what you expect.

This movie is the best Austin Powers ever in the history of.........Austin Powers.  I saw this movie twice on the same day and I must say it was really good.  There was only one thing left out, we never found out what happened to Felecity Shagwell. Over all BEST COMEDY THIS SUMMER.

Review title: The beginning and middle were funny but the ending SUCKED (WARNING: MAJOR SPOILERS)
Review_body: Although not a true fan, I enjoy the Austin Powers series and looked forward to the release of the third sequel. First, I must say that at first Beyoncé Knowles seemed to be out of place but as the movie went on she seemed fit in pretty well but was quite different than Elizabeth Hurley or Heather Graham were to the other Austin Powers movies. Although there wasn't much of a plotline (Dr. Evil hatched a plot to destroy the world but it wasn't as prominent as in the other two movies), there were plenty of jokes true to the storyline as well as entertaining action.Until the end, that is, where there was a huge plot twist that absolutely ruined the Austin Powers franchise.WARNING: LOTS OF SPOILERS AHEAD...SKIP THIS IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN THE MOVIE!I have to say that the cameos in the beginning were absolutely hilarious, with my favorite being Danny DeVito as Mini-Me. The middle wasn't quite as funny, but it still has its entertaining moments. The Fat Bastard sumo wrestling scene, the Godzilla "copyright , infringement" scene, and Mini-Me's remarks to Foxy Cleopatra about "having a little clone inside herself" were some of my favorites. The one thing that really annoys me is that they made a big deal of going back in time to 1975 but were there for what, five minutes?Now for the end: As Scott Evil loses his trademark character and becomes "Evil", Nigel Powers (Austin Powers's father) reveals that he is Dr. Evil's father as well and they all come together in one big happy family...so Austin Powers and Dr. Evil (not to mention his entire organization) are friends. Aside from the fact that this was not funny at all, it also left very little room for a future installment (which I would have liked). Are the producers and writers trying to kill the franchise? What's next, Austin against Scott Evil? That would be awful.On a side note, Goldmember seemed to be a pointless addition.Overall, I would give Austin Powers in Goldmember a 6.5 out of 10. The first (Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery) was my favorite with The Spy who Shagged Me second and Goldmember third.

Review title: Some Funny Jokes But nothing special
Review_body: When you think of Austin Powers you think of a good jokes and a good time. But when you see Austin Powers 3 you wonder what in the world was Myers thinking. This does not even come close to living up to the first 2 movies. A bunch of raunchy jokes and overused gags we've seen before in the other movies cant save this plot that looks like a grade school child wrote. While Myers usually gives us creatvity and originality  this movie is far from it.

Goldmember was a lot of fun.  The first 10 minutes was some of the funniest stuff i'd seen in a long time.  The cameos were VERY funny.Dr. Evils musical number, in the prison, was equally as funny, as was Austin beating up Mini Me.....too funny!If you liked the first two, go see this one.  Definately worth the price of admission.

This Austin Powers was by far the funniest of the three. Don´t get me wrong, I love Austin´s first movies but I think Mike Myers really found his Mojo. Also Seth Green is funnier now that he has a slightly bigger role in the film. Beyonce could have down a better job but nothing can spoil this picture. I hope there´s a fourth and a fifth and so-on. It was absolutely groovy baby!!!

The plotline was okay, the jokes, not many, but the thought behind it and the acting was great... i give major props to mmike myers for his 4 acting roles and the story line, major props to mighale caine for playing the randy,Nigel Powers, but over all, i give this movie a 4 and no more

Review title: Don't give up on the series.
Review_body: Throwing in the towel is exactly what I was planning to do after seeing The Spy Who Shagged Me.  However, Goldmember was really amusing.  I don't need to get into all the characters (you don't really want to read about them,) but I will tell you that the abundance of Myers' is very well done and the developing connections between all the characters is quite fun to follow. Scott remains the wildcard, and although this movie by no means resolves the Powers/Evil dynamic, it seems to me that this angle will play itself out like Steve McGarrett v. Wo Fat in Hawaii 5-0.Although this is essentially a goofy spy movie, the spy plot is totally unimportant.  If you like Tom Clancy or a good Harrison Ford thriller, you won't enjoy this movie.  The true action is on the level of the relationships and feelings these characters hold for each other; I know that may sound crazy, but I found it thoroughly intriguing.  As an earlier poster noted, this move is DEFINITELY for the OUT crowd - you'll read it on another level.  I will note that my straight counterparts enjoyed this film and it will definitely appeal to anyone in the mood for a funny and strangely touching film.

In my opinion many of the critics have been overly harsh in their reviews
of
the
latest "Austin Powers" movie.  Is this movie on par with "Citizen Kane?"
No, nor
was it ever intended to be.  Mike Meyers is the one individual who can take
crude and sophmoric humor and make it genuinely unoffensive and funny at
the
same time.  It's his gift, which he uses well in this third installment of
the "Austin
Powers" series.The opening sequence of the movie, which features some wonderfully
utilitzed
cameos was worth the price of admission all on its own.  The starpower and
Hollywood muscle utilized in the first five minutes of the film
demonstrates
that
Meyers is worthy of our attention.  Meyers' gifted comic characters are
skillfully
represented with vulnerability and sensitivity that go far beyond the comic
intentions of the film its self.  Whether it be the vulnerability of "Fat
Bastard," the
insecurities of "Dr. Evil,"  or the "always misses the boat" silliness of
the film's
title character, Meyers manages to give each one a soul that makes his
audience care.Critics be damned, the third installment of "Austin Powers" is a "gotta
see"
movie.

In my opinion many of the critics have been overly harsh in their reviews of the latest "Austin Powers" movie.  Is this movie on par with "Citizen Kane?" No, nor was it ever intended to be.  Mike Meyers is the one individual who can take crude and sophmoric humor and make it genuinely unoffensive and funny at the same time.  It's his gift, which he uses well in this third installment of the "Austin Powers" series.The opening sequence of the movie, which features some wonderfully utilitzed cameos was worth the price of admission all on its own.  The starpower and Hollywood muscle utilized in the first five minutes of the film demonstrates that Meyers is worthy of our attention.  Meyers' gifted comic characters are skillfully represented with vulnerability and sensitivity that go far beyond the comic intentions of the film its self.  Whether it be the vulnerability of "Fat Bastard," the insecurities of "Dr. Evil,"  or the "always misses the boat" silliness of the film's title character, Meyers manages to give each one a soul that makes his audience care.Critics be damned, the third installment of "Austin Powers" is a "gotta see" movie.

Awesome stuff. The best one of the three!!!  Gotta own it.  Can't wait for the DVD. Movie is full of skits and the best part is the opening of the film. Warning-- Your stomach may experience severe cramps from non stop laughter.

Review title: What has happened to Austin Powers?
Review_body:
When I was about to see this movie, I was thinking,'Something tells me this movie isn't going to be that great'. I thought it couldn't beat the very hilarious second Austin movie. But I just thought I should see it and see what it is like in case I was wrong. But it turns out I was right! 'Austin Powers In Goldmember' was the worst Austin Powers so far. I hope the supposed 4th movie that is coming out in a few years time is MUCH better.There were a few funny jokes such as Fat Bastard singing on the toilet and the funny text on the bottom of the screen during the conversation with Mr. Roboto the Japanese guy. But the characters had no meaning! Austin was hardly a sex symbol in this 3rd installment (he was a 'sexy beast' in the other two films), and Mini me turned to Austin's side and Scott turned evil! They lost the characters completly. I could on for ages about the characters stupid transformations. They even had hardly any 70's music where as in the first 2 flicks, they had great music for the era known as the 60's. But I gotta admit...the celebrity appearances were quite good.
I ain't knocking Mike Myers. He is excellent and even Beyonce Knowles who plays Foxxy Cleopatra was pretty good at acting but I didn't think much of the movie at all. They made huge mistakes. They even deleted Heather Graham's appearance as Felicity Shagwell, Austin's second leading lady from the second film.To those who haven't seen the previous Austin flicks, and are about to see the 3rd please.......See the 'Spy Who Shagged Me' first, as that is the FUNNIEST of all Austin Powers flicks.Very disappointing...............

As a fan of the first two Austin Powers films, I was eagerly awaiting the release of Goldmember.  After seeing the film however, I am very disappointed.The movie, to me, seemed very 'incoherent'.  The plot did not seem to run as smoothly as the last two.  It seemed to be just thrown together haphazardly. It is although the producers thought "oh oh, what was funny from the last one?  ok, that bit was, we'll put that there... and this bit there... and we'll slightly change that bit and put it there... and we'll add a couple of new things here and there."  And that about sums up the movie: tired old worn-out gags and jokes, and a couple of new things for a chuckle or two.The 'plot' itself, if you can really call it a plot, was introduced incredibly fast, with no real reasoning or explanation.  I guess it's a case of "yes, we're the bad guys, and we're going to destroy the world" once again, but at least in the last two movies they actually seemed to mean it. In this one, it was as though Dr. Evil and Co. weren't even trying.The best part of the whole movie, in my opinion, was the opening sequence. Very funny and very witty - pity the rest of the movie didn't follow suit. If you do see this movie, see it for the first five or ten minutes, then walk out or switch it off.Goldmember himself as a character was just... very, very odd.  I don't know that many Dutch people, but I'm sure the producers have never met one in their life judging from their "typically Dutch" Goldmember.  He didn't really do anything dramatic throughout the whole movie until the very end, and seeing how the film's title was "Goldmember", you'd expect him to feature just a little more than he did.Other flaws I noticed include:*  What happened to Heather Graham's character after the last movie?  Has she just vanished?  I have heard she was supposed to get a cameo but they cut it.*  Where was Mustafa?  With all the re-used bits from the past two movies, surely they could have thrown him in there too for a couple of chuckles.*  I didn't mind Austin's Dad being there so much, but something I learned a long time ago is that when family members of main characters in a TV series or in films start being introduced, it's usually a sign that the TV or film series is dying.  If this movie is anything to go by, I'd say that Austin Powers' days are extremely numbered.* A certain play-on-words joke failed in Australia because we don't have a product on our shelves with the same name... the audience worked it out after a little while, but it didn't have the desired effect... they need to be more careful with word gags like that... with the last two movies they picked things that were more well known.Finally, perhaps the biggest flaw of all: AUSTIN DIDN'T GET A SHAG!  The poor old chap!  Third movie and he's over the hill, eh?  He had the incredibly attractive Foxy Cleopatra at his side throughout the entire movie, and not once did he jump on a revolving bed and say "DO I MAKE YOU HORNY, BABY?  DO I MAKE YOU RANDY?"  Not once!  Oh well Austin, time to hang a certain Swedish "adult product"... looks like you won't be needing that anymore.

Review title: fairly good action comedy yet somewhat slow
Review_body: I recently watched Austin Powers in Goldmember after waiting for months to be able to see it fully. I had heard positive comments about the film. I found it to be fairly entertaining with some good action sequences, but it also had a lot of weak parts which were boring and slow.If you want to see the film without knowing what takes place in the storyline then it is best to stop reading my review and go buy it and watch it, because my review HAS SPOILERS. However, if you want to know a little more about what takes in the film before you see it, then continue reading my review.The opening action sequence when Austin parachutes into a car was decent but not as exciting as the action sequences in movies like Terminator 3, X2 Xmen United, The Bourne Ultimatum, Live Free or Die Hard, or XXX state of the Union, but it is important to remember that this is an action comedy as well as a James Bond Parody but not an action thriller. I am now going to state to you in two separate paragraphs what I liked and what I didn't like as much.Some of the enjoyable scenes include the sumo fight where Fat Bastard sends his opponent flying in the air, the fight in the changing room where Austin fights with Fat Bastard, the meeting with Mr Roboto, the scene where Austin is urinating, the part where Austin and Foxy infiltrate the factory and rescue Nigel, the car chase through Tokyo,the roller disco club, the part where Nigel comes to the submarine layer, the scene where Austin and Foxy escape Goldmember's club with the girls shooting at them, the part when Austin and Mini Me are behind a screen door, and last but not least the part when Dr Evil and the prisoners sing "Hard Knock Life." Now it might sound like I enjoyed everything in the film but that is not true. There were many scenes that made the film feel bland and simple. Some of those scenes include the knighting ceremony, the scene where Austin visits Dr Evil in jail, the flashback at the academy, and the scene when Dr Evil realizes he is Austin's brother, and he turns good. These were some of the weak aspects of the film. Another problem with this movie was that some scenes had too much dialogue but not enough action. But some of it is funny, like Fahza and mole for instance.But I think everyone should watch Goldmember at least twice especially Austin Powers fans who enjoyed the first two movies.Wheather this film is worth owning depends on you. If you are a movie buff like me who loves non stop action blockbuster then it might not be the film that belongs in your collection but that is up to you. If you are an Austin fan who likes comedy movies and is a fan of the sixties spy films, then this would be a perfect film to include in your DVD collection. This would also be a good film to own if you are a person like me who wants to own a lot of DVDs.Overall, this was a good film to see. It was something different from the other films I see and had an equal share of good scenes as it did of bad scenes. Yes some parts of the movie are slow but that is because this is a James Bond parody and many of the Bond films were slow at times.I would like to end my review by saying that the best way to decide if this is a movie for you is by watching it.Good Luck and Have Fun

The first Austin Powers movie was brilliant, the second one dragged quite a lot (perhaps half as good) and this one is just awful. Beyoncé Knowles is the only reason to watch it and even she can't make it enjoyable. Please, no more, or at least not unless Myers can get away from the toilet humour. It's just not funny. 1 out of 10.

Review title: A little too dirty, but still great.
Review_body: Although I really liked this movie I didn't like the new character, Goldmember. I also thought it was a little too dirty for me. They could have done without the twins and made Mini Me a little less nasty. As you can tell by my sign-in name I love all three Austin Powers movies, but they're a lot funnier when they don't go too far with the dirty jokes. Still, Goldmember is a another hilariously funny Austin Powers movie!

Review title: would you like a Smoke and a pancake?
Review_body: I love Gollllldddddd member :-)Goldmember is fantastic. Everytime I think of Austin Powers Films, my favourite changes. This time it is Goldmember.In this film, there is less Fat Bastard (a good thing) and a new character , Goldmember, who is just genius. If you have the DVD check out the extra scenes, they are hilarious.Goldmember's quotes are superb, "Dutch Hater", "kc and the sunshine band", "ooh thats a keeper."The plot is a bit ropey, but as this franchise is all about set pieces. and it works. 9 out of 10 times the comedy works, and 9 out of ten is what I give it.And for those who are interested.....1. Beyonce 2. Heather Graham 3. Elizabeth Hurley

I can't say enough about this movie. it has all the elements of a great comedy. in-jokes,sarcasm,pop culture references,laugh out loud moments and the dialog is the best in the series and in any comedy in a long time. mike myers is a comic genius and should be given more credit for the work he does here. the series is in its third installment and myers is more than comfortable in all the different characters skin's. he even adds goldmember to the list. the casting in these movies is perfect as well. Micheal cane as nigel powers was pure genius and keeping all the originals around was great(major props have to be given to seth green,robert wagner and mindy sterling) they play off myers perfectly and it wouldn't have been the same movie without them support mr powers...i mean...mr myers;) the only complaint i have with the movie is beyonce as the new powers girl. she does do the part well but she is just so dam annoying, but she stays out of the way enough not to make it a big detriment on the film as a whole. i just can't say enough about this movie. its one of those movies you can laugh at over and over again and even find something new that you missed the first dozen times you watch it. i suggest if you haven't seen this movie go out and rent it NOW!..and watch it at least twice cause you'll miss some really good plans...err....dialog from laughing so much.my rating is 10/10 a perfect comedy

Review title: A few good laughs, but it tries too hard
Review_body: It's not bad, but not great either.  There are some good laughs, a couple of REALLY good laughs and a lot of re-hashed jokes from the first two movies.There's a lot more scatological humor in this one, gross-out gags and the like.  The plot is the weakest in the series...in fact it seems that the plot is only used as a tool to introduce (and re-introduce) jokes.  There's never a real sense that the evil plot is really playing out, and the climax and conclusion are downright silly.As much as I enjoyed the first two movies, I was more than a bit let down by Goldmember.  It's got its moments, but overall it shows us that this franchise has reached the end of it's life.

I thought the ending was a tad lame, but on the whole the movie was pretty darn funny. The opening credits are great (especially what happens to Brittany Spears.... we could only hope...). There are some scenes that are absolutely side splitting (one involves Mini-Me and Austin behind a screen.... you have to see it). I was disappointed in the character Goldmember. I didn't find him all that funny. There are some variations on some jokes being repeated from the prior two movies (as Ozzy points out quite comically) but there are plenty of new laughs as well. I rate this one 8/10.

I just watched the movie and thought I would laugh myself to death! Anybody who liked the first two movies will love this one as well and it is far underrated until now (6.7 avg.). Go and see and return to vote. I understand this is not the movie for everybody, but hey, you shouldn't watch it if you don't like Mike Myers. It's as simple as that.Now enjoy!

I though the movie had some funny moments and some jokes that didn't work. Reference a previous comment, have you even seen the movie? If so, why? Obviously you are familiar with the Austin Powers series and you know what it's all about, ie the bathroom humor. Assuming you've even watched the movie, why did you waste your 90 minutes knowing full well it would be more of the same? Given that which are you, a dummy, a feminist or one of the brainwashed masses?

As a big fan of the first two Austin Powers movies, I was extremely disappointed in this one.  After an incredibly hilarious first ten minutes, everything falls apart.  The jokes are lame retreads from the previous films, and the story is abysmal, with an ending that makes no sense and will make you cringe.The new characters (Foxxy, Goldmember) are ok, but are nowhere near as funny or clever as the new characters introduced in the Spy Who Shagged Me (Mini-Me, Fat Bastard).  Indeed, Goldmember and Foxxy aren't given much screen time at all, are given almost nothing to do.Through the whole film, whenever it feels as though the jokes are about to get funny, things just fall flat.  After the opening (which is brilliant), the movie just never gets on track.  In the theater I was in, you could tell the audience really wanted to laugh... but was never really given much to laugh about.I hate to say it, but it looks like the Austin Powers franchise has lost its mojo.

Review title: Plot? Surely you're missing the point!
Review_body: "Sneak Preview" 9.25pm Manhattan Beach, CA 25th July 2002.Some minor spoilers (more like "don't miss this"), nothing significant IMNSHO.I certainly was not disappointed, but you shouldn't expect a very detailed plot here. There are several "laugh out loud" scenes with quite a lot of visual gags - which will probably appeal more to the male half of the audience (it did in the cinema I saw it in). Myers added a new character and brought out all the old characters in this piece. The new bad-guy, "Goldmember", is Dutch with a thick Dutch accent. Living in Amsterdam, I particularly appreciated this. Dr Evil was in very good form and Mini-Me was well used. Sadly, I felt that the Austin character was actually the weakest of the bunch in this episode, with Myers being somewhat inconsistent with Austin's accent and the character being less flamboyant than I expected. Mole!English (British) audiences will appreciate the Cocky-rhyming-slang scene, which is subtitled for "foreigners". The older among you should look out for the "I thank you!" - a little Eric Morecambe phrase used by both Myers and Caine.Nice cameo appearances from several very well known celebrities - Nathan Lane has a nice part and John Travolta shows up unexpectedly.The credits have some nice out-takes.Trivia (may be considered a spoiler):Some trivia - Burt Bacharach (and Hal David) wrote "What's it all about, Alfie" for the film "Alfie", starring Michael Caine. Scenes from Alfie are used to depict Michael Caine as a young man in a flashback scene. Burt Bacharach performs in the movie and the final song is "What's it all about, Austin", sung (I think) by Britney Spears - who's also in the movie. Nice and not wasted on me.

I liked the first one. I absolutely loved the second one, and I expected that this one was going to be the best of the series. Well, it wasn't. They movie just isn't funny enough. Sure, there are some great gags, especially the opening sequence, but on the whole it's a major let-down. No coherent story line and no plot. Waste of time.Mike Myers has lost his mojo. I give at 2/10.

Review title: Alot of the same jokes, but funny as ever.
Review_body: If you loved the first 2 Austin Powers movies, this one won't disappoint you.  Yeah, Mike Meyers recycles some old jokes, but they are just as funny today.  Not as disgusting as AP2, Goldmember delivers solid hilarity (I think I only wanted to puke once [the 'Flaking' Dutchman] yeah baby!). The cameos in Goldmember alone are worth the price of admission.Don't miss this one!

Did this movie make me laugh? Occasionally, I'll admit, but not as much as I would have liked.Maybe I'm missing the point of the Austin Powers movies in general, but even the first one seemed like it was a conglomeration of old, used jokes. Even the spy movie satire elements were nothing that other movies hadn't poked fun at dozens of times before.When the first sequel appeared a couple of years back, a few of the jokes still had enough life left in them to repeat one last time, but now that Goldmember is here, I assure you, all remaining humor has long since been wrung out of them.If you want to see yet another try at the sugegstive shadow scene, the fembots (this time with a celebrity cameo in a desparate attempt to make them funny again), more clone jokes, and even more of the father/son conflict than you saw before, then by all means, feel free to go for another helping, and don't let my criticism stop you, but don't blame me if you feel like you've seen it all before.

Review title: very very very very very funny
Review_body: This Austin Powers made you laugh from the start to end it might be better than one and two this movie will make you feel better when you leave the movie Mike Myers he is a very good actor that he can play all those people and Mike Caine was very good as Myers father hopefuly there will be a A. powers 4

Review title: Dry and tired, though the shagging's not...
Review_body: It may be safe to say that any of the Mike Myers' Austin Powers films are sure to make you laugh, as all of them have for me.  Maybe that is why we all rushed out to see the third installment, Austin Powers in Goldmember, out of commitment and curiosity.  However, a part of me says you can still watch the first two and get the same banter you will from the third one. Don't get me wrong, there is plenty original material in Goldmember, some really funny jokes and the ever popular Dr.Evil - MiniMe Duet, but the series grows tired, and even dry.  I already knew Austin Powers can dance to make girls heads explode, I knew Dr. Evil likes to ask for obnoxious sums of money, and I knew Fat Bastard is slightly uncouth. These things are repeated, not subliminally, but instead there to smack you in the face. Ok fine, touch base with the preceding films. Now on to good stuff, the new stuff. There were some scenes alone that definitely made this film worth seeing, and worth laughing. One being the urine sample scene, conspicuously as silhouettes on a curtain, and the subtitles scene.  New additions such as the gaseous Evil Submarine and the energetic Beyonce Knowles refresh the film, reminding the audience of Myers' creativeness. If you're a Powers fan, you've already seen the movie, if you're teetering on the edge, make sure you haven't seen the first two movies in a while.

Review title: Just as funny in a diffrent sort of way
Review_body: Goldmember is hilarious.  That's the one word review.  The beauty of all the Austin Power's movies is that they're all movies that you have to watch about three or four times just to catch all of the jokes or double entendres.  Even if you do watch them that often, you still, most likely missed something.Watching this movie, especially the opening credits sequence and the prologue, you seem to think back to the other two films and remark to yourself: "Wow, the budgets and special effects have gotten a lot better!" then, you get that warm fuzzy feeling inside as if you've seen your kids grow up and you get more and more proud of what they've done.

This is the biggest disgrace. The first two were hilarious, but this had a terrible plot. I cannot stress how bad it was. All they did was repeat jokes that were only funny the first two times. The characters were so dumb, and why did they totally destroy every possible plot element they had. Mini me became good, Dr. Evil was austin powers' brother, Scott replaced mini me and went bald? Goldmember???? I'm confused. This movie suÂ¢ked......

As several reviewers have already commented...whadda ya want??  It was an Austin Powers movie!!  And it lived up to the previous two.  I laughed all the way through and thoroughly enjoyed myself.  I like an "art" film full of serious symbolism as much as the next film snob, but all I wanted this evening was to be entertained in truly sophomoric fashion--and I got my wish!  A fun film!! Go.. enjoy...

I had to pause after watching the intro. I totally laughed my head of! The first 3 minutes alone is worth the ticket. Since the movie has not had premiere yet, I won't spoil it by tellin anything, but this is the best Austin Powers movies yet! The most action packed, totally crazy and utterly unpredictable. I laughed hard the whole movie, and beyond. This is a film I could, and will, see over and over and over.

Ok, so we're back for the third go-round with Austin Powers. This movie will make you laugh, but it is really beginning to reach. The ending is one of those that wraps everything up, but then again, leaves the possibility for more sequels.Michael Caine is excellent as Austin's father. Seeing that the teeth run in the family is amusing. The opening of the movie gets one of the biggest laughs. Cameo is the name of the game.I was disappointed that there was no Will Ferrell in this sequel, and there was no end-of-the-credits joke. So don't stick around in the theater expecting something else, it isn't there.

Review title: Not as good a as 1 and 2 but still funny
Review_body: I saw this on Thursday 25th at a preview screening at Bluewater, KentIt's slow to get going and there are some really crap jokes (Austin Powers climbs up a ladder behind Dr Evil and rips his trousers and then says "I can clearly see you're nuts"), but there were some better funny moments.  The 'Convoy' piss take is great (Convoy is my My favourite movie).The goldmember character is not funny, Nigel Powers (Michael Caine) just seems out of place.  Dr Evil and Mini Me are funny as always.5.5 out of 10I heard somebody come out of the cinema to say it was better than the first two, I would say it was not.

This movie was not bad, but was not that good either. The jokes in the movie were funny but they were the same as the first two movies so it just got old. Austin Powers #1 and #2 are far better than this film mainly because it didnt repeat the same jokes as much. All in all, Mike Meyers is still my hero, but they need to drop the whole Goldmember segment because it was not funny at all.

Review title: Low brow for sure, but we hardly stopped laughing
Review_body: I see that Austin Powers is getting very mixed reviews, both from the pros and IMDB users, and be assured that it will not be joining Some Like It Hot and Tootsie as one of the funniest and intelligent movies of all time. Perhaps it suffers a bit from a wee too much scatology.  And the plot is the barest wisp of a framework to hold the movie together.  It's really just a series of gags and sketches.Nevertheless, I recommend this movie for the simplest of reasons: The audience I saw this with, including me, hardly stopped laughing throughout. A few of the gags are so gross they'll make you wince, and a few are carryovers from the first two Austin Powers films, but on the whole the movie is one funny, creative bit after another. And the many surprise cameos are a hoot.Kudos too for Beyoncé Knowles for a funny and charming turn as Foxy Cleopatra.  While not the most complex female lead in film history, she fills the limited demands of the role nicely.These days, a film that does nothing more than keep me laughing for an hour and a half will get my vote every time.8 out of 10

After the introduction, this movie was unoriginal. Mike Myers just used the same jokes that had made the two previous movies successful by putting them into this awful third edition of a franchise that started out so well. I hope that Mike comes up with some original jokes for a fourth edition that ends the franchise on a positive note.

Review title: Don't let anyone ruin the first 5 minutes!
Review_body: Goldmember is a perfect accent to the first two films.  It revisits old material without driving it into the ground and adds new touches without taking the series in a new direction. Myers is, as usual, above perfection in his performance.  Dr. Evil continues to be the best of the characters and provides a hysterical lyrical turn that must be seen to be believed. The film wraps up in a respectable place where it can be equally viable as the last Austin movie or provide a turning point if the series continues. Once again a genius comic spoof that is made even more enjoyable for fans of the James Bond series who catch all the in jokes along the way.

This is, by far, the best and funniest of the Austin Powers trilogies!  The opening alone made my husband and I laugh so hard that tears were rolling down our cheeks.  The use of the cameos made the film even more hilarious.The only drawback to Mike Myers' characters was "Goldmember".  He was not what I had hoped for in that his part was not as humorous as those of his other characters.  I did, however, enjoy the other characters that Mike Myers played.The movie was a laugh a minute and the audience that was there when I saw it were rolling on the floor laughing.Thanks, Mike Myers, for such an entertaining film!

I was looking forward to seeing this so much, I had read reviews that raved about it. I had seen the last two (many, many times) and loved them to bits. But I came out very disappointed.It looked like a film that was made for the sake of making a film. Ok, so I did laugh, there are a few good moments but "on the whole" I was cringing for large chunks of this film. Too much of it was poorly thought out humour, where the jokes were obvious and just not funny.The set of characters for this film were poor. Foxy Cleopatra??? She might as well not have been in that film at all, why was she anyway? Terrible, how many times did she say the same thing? Number 2? Why was he there?, underused. Frau (Not going to attempt to spell her name, you know who!) was underused too. Micheal Caine's character was terrible and he got landed with two of the worst jokes in this film. I was glad to see Fat Bastard back, because I liked him, but, like most of this film, his appearance was all a bit pointless. In a film that never really goes anywhere.It all ended up being complete nonsense and the already weak storyline fell to pieces. I doubt there will be a 4th, I think Ive just witnessed the sad ending of another good series of films.

Review title: Dirty, but still very groovy, baby!
Review_body: This movie was everything I thought it would be, and then some. In my opinion (and I'm sure there are people who will disagree with me), this was the best Austin Powers flick yet. They reused a lot of jokes from the first two, but where as you thought they would be stale, they twisted them into a whole new light. I had stitches in my side during the Osbournes scene(I won't give anything away).Going into the movie, I wasn't quite sure what the tagline meant by "The Secret will Be Exposed". Coming out of the movie, I realized that the BIG secret at the end made almost everything come full circle.But other than that, the ending really set up for a sequel. I really enjoyed this film, and I should hope to see Austin Powers 4 in the years to come.

So, the opening sequence is a great parody of a very popular action film in a sequence that is so over the top (literally even) that it had me wishing it was in a more "serious" action film. I was sitting there thinking, "Oh yeah, they pulled out all the stops for this one." Unfortunately they apparently felt so confident in this film that they let a 6th grader finish writing the rest of the film during lunch period. After the first 15 minutes this film turns to witless toilet humor so un-funny you'll wish Gallagher would show up and smash something. Borrow it for free from someone who's bad taste and blind devotion to Mike Myers (who I used to love) suckered them into buying it.

The only thing unique about this movie is that you only have to pay once to get all the jokes from the first two movies. Unfortunately there are only a few more jokes and none worth the ticket price, and I've already paid to see the jokes in the first two. Do yourself a favor. STAY HOME!!!! Watch the first two. You will not be missing anything.
