Austin Powers in Goldmember is terrible. It is merely a continuation of jokes presented in International Man of Mystery and The Spy Who Shagged Me, never standing on its own. The first two were genually humorus films, but Goldmember pushes no new ground and there is really only about 5 minutes of funny moments.Liked it? Ask yourself this: Are you laughing because it is funny or because it is Austin Powers? Question why you are laughing, and is it even funny?

This movie ROCKS!!!!  From the opening (which was clever), to the unveiling of the "secret" at the end, this movie brings down the house with its unique brand of comedy.  The audience was laughing throughout!!! (I almost squirted my soda out of my nose at the Preperation H joke!)Mike Myers takes on quadruple duty in this one, playing Austin, Dr. Evil, Goldmember, and Fat Bastard (whose presence in this movie wasn't THAT important).  To my knowledge, only Eddie Murphy has played more roles in a comedy portraying the entire Klump family.  Anyway, Myers is AMAZING to say the least.  He does a fantastic job playing the good guys, the bad guys, and even the fat guys.Beyonce Knowls did an Ok job as Foxy Cleopatra, but her chareacter didn't get as much screen time as I thought she would.  Oh well, she still had her moments.Verne Troyer returns as Mini-me in this film, and Mini-me is still well... Mini-me.  Intresting to note that Troyer does all of his own stunts.  I would never do half the things he did in this movie, and I'm 6'1"!!!Of course, all of the other henchmen for Dr. Evil returns as well. Unfortunatly for Robert Wagner (Number 2) and Mindy Sterling (Frau Farbissina) they get less exposure than in previous installments. (I think that would be a good thing for Sterling.  All that yelling...)Seth Green also returns as Scott Evil.  I like Scott because he says what's on my mind whenever I hear a bad Dr. Evil joke. (Remember Operation Wang Chung from the second movie?  Classic).As for celebrities, watch for cameos from Brittney Spears, Quincy Jones, Tom Cruise, Danny Devito, Steven Speilburg, John Travolta, and the Osbournes among others.  Man, last time I saw so many stars, I was looking through a telescope!!!Also funny in this movie is the recuring jokes, one of which is in this review.  All in all, Goldmember is the best Austin Powers movie yet.  I'm only imagining what they will do for the sequel (although with all the sudden twists in the movie, it will be hard to figure out what the heck they will do next).Oh and one more thing, WHAT EVER HAPPENED TO FELICITY SHAGWELL?!?!?!

this movie is hilarious luckily i caught a pre-screnning last night! it is better than the second but it does use some of the great jokes from AP2 the good thing is mini-me joins the good side! this will be a great film for all the austin powers fans out there but if they make another film after this one it willl get cheesy with no jokes..

Review title: WATCH FOR THE LINE: "One of us will have to go on the others shoulders!"
Review_body: From that line through the next five minutes, it's one of the funniest sequences I've EVER seen!  Everybody, I MEAN EVERYBODY is absolutely FANTASTIC in this movie!  Also, this has one of the best movie openers I've seen in a LONG time (you'll know what I mean when you see it)!  If you feel like getting out of the house for a laugh, or if you liked the other Austin Powers movies, GO SEE THIS!!!  It's probably the best of the series so far! I just hope Mike Myers will make another (I hear he wants to...YES) :-)!

I thought it was a overall good comedy but I believe that they had to much dancing in the movie. I felt a little da-va-ju with all the repeated jokes. I don't think anybody really liked Goldmember. He was just plain , nobody laugh a his jokes when I was sitting in the theater. They certainly could have gotting some one that could act to play the part of Mrs. Foxy Cleopatra. One moment in the movie really made me sick, when that damn Britney Spears showed her face. Do get me wrong I love her face , along with other things , but it ruined the movie for me. Spears was the only cameo they would have been better off leaving out. Overall I gave it a 5/10.

I loved International Man of Mystery. The Spy Who Shagged Me was OK but not as original. Goldmember is a sorry excuse of a sequel. As is pointed out, the gags seem to be recycled but placed in a different order. Goldmember is a very poor and underdeveloped character. He is a two joke character that is not enough to base a movie on. Michael Caine is.... Michael Caine (pass the cheque and I'll show up). The best part is the opening sequence and a scene set in a Japanese mogul's office. Even my sister, who is a great Austin fan, was not impressed with this. Definitely a spoof to far.

All of the early reviews I read for GOLDMEMBER were positive, so I was psyched about going to a special WNFZ radio station sponsored sneak preview of the latest installment of AUSTIN POWERS.  Then I saw it.  *sigh*  It was really, really not as good as THE SPY WHO SHAGGED ME.  Okay, granted, there were about six (maybe seven) really good laughs.  They were just few and far between.I know it seems rather shallow to base an opinion of a movie on how many times you laugh, but with the AUSTIN POWERS franchise, you have to. Besides, IT'S A COMEDY!  Think of THE SPY WHO SHAGGED ME.  You didn't watch it for the incredible plot development.  (And if you did, I'm really, really sorry.)  You saw it to laugh.  And I did.  I laughed so hard my sides hurt when I left.But this time around, we've seen all of these jokes before.  The musical numbers.  The "That looks like a giant--[penis reference]."  They're just kind of hackneyed.  I wanted something new.  The second AUSTIN POWERS had more laughs because it took the humor in different (although more disgusting) directions.  It's like Mike Myers just took his last script, changed some wording, and threw it into the Hollywood movie-making machine.I will give the movie this: the opener is great.  The cameos are hysterical. Then you get in to the rest of the movie, and it's like The M & M Show (Mike Myers--get it?).  Also, it's sloppy.  And that's where the laughs fall flat.  They're not even trying anymore.  It feels like Mike Myers is too aware of his ability to create humor.  He mugs at the camera as if to say, "It doesn't matter what I do--you WILL laugh."  Well, I defy you, Mike Myers!!!  I just can't laugh in the presence of comic arrogance.  Unless it's my own.

I saw this on an advanced screening and it was hilarious!!! Although not as good as the previous two. It was however funnier. The first movie was more original, but lacked the comedy that this one made up for.  I am a big comedy fan and believe that this movie, although not as cunning as the first two, is the best Austin Powers movie so far.

Review title: If you liked the first two, you'll like this...
Review_body: ...and that's all there is to it. The same old groan-inducing jokes and the same old silly Mel Brooks style comedy. The first five minutes of the film are fantastic; no-one in the audience guessed what was coming. Check it out, whether it's on the big screen, DVD or videotape.

Review title: It's the best yet baby, YEAH!!!!!!!
Review_body: I have seen this twice now, its that good :). New jokes, new characters and a great scene at the beginning featuring a movie that steven speilberg is making about "Austin Powers" called "Austinpussy", starring Tom Cruise as Austin, Gwenyth Paltrow as Dixy normas, Kevin spacey as Dr. Evil and even funnier.... Danny devito as Mini Me.As far as the plotline goes.... Austins dad has been kidnapped by "Goldmember" (again played by Myers) and Austin has to use Dr. Evil to find out where he is. So Austin travels back to 1975 and gets help from Foxy Cleapatra (destinys child's Beyonce knowles).At the same time, Scott evil (Dr Evils son) is turning evil and Mini me is feeling outcast as Dr Evil is spending more time with his son. So Mini me decides to help Austin (brilliant scene with a mini-austin).Excellent movie. Only one little problem. I don't think that goldmember was used enough.  Given time I think he will be a brilliant character.

Let me start off by saying that I was greatly disappointed with "Austin Powers in Goldmember." We waited 2 hours to see it the night it came out, and I was mad to discover that it turned grossly corney after the first 10 minutes. Granted, I did laugh out loud maybe 3 or 4 times through the rest of the movie, however the third installment of this series is no where near the witticism of the first two. There were nothing but stupid cliches and played out jokes in this movie. Foxy Cleopatra's character was completely underdeveloped. One thing that made the first two movies great was the dynamic relationship between Austin and his leading lady, and there is none of this in Goldmember.I suppose my biggest qualm with this movie was that the editing was HORRIBLE. It was so ridiculously choppy, it seemed like half of the plot must have been cut out. I mean, there were no transitions between scenes what so ever. And where the hell did Britney Spears come from?Finally, why the heck is this movie called "Goldmember" in the first place? The Goldmember character is barely even in it, and he is so not funny it's embarrassing to watch.Ok, so my overall rating for this movie is a D+, only because the Tom Cruise bit was hilarious.

Another excellent AP movie from Mike Myers and Jay Roach.  The introduction of the very sexy Beyonce Knowles and the movie spoof opening and ending put this movie over the top.  And with Scott's progressive balding and struggle to become closer to his dad, they created a hilarious subplot.  All in all, a great movie.  One wonders where the series will go after the ending (won't spoil it!)

Review title: More of the same - not that that's a bad thing!
Review_body: If you like Mike Meyers in all of his various 'Powers' guises, step right up and buy a ticket for this most madcap sequel to 'Austin Powers'. With only a few momentary slowdowns in the gag-a-second pace, this picture will keep the fans happy. It's obvious that Mike and company are enjoying themselves, and more than willing to poke fun at their own work, even as it happens. Enjoy!

I liked the other movies in the series but this one is stretching it. Everybody does a good job but the characters are not as fresh as before, and the story is getting real tired. Mike Myers should retire and go on to create a brand new world.  Give it a shot but after that move on.

Review title: Very Good, But The Spy Who Shagged Me Was Better
Review_body: Goldmember was really good, it was very funny with all the usual Myers Antics. Of course there could always be hotter "Austin Girls" (not to say Fook Yu and Fook Mi weren't hot,) and some original ideas would be nice, nonetheless, it was great, but I still think The Spy Who Shagged Me was better.

There is no other word suitable for this movie but that which describes our excriment, what comes out of our butt is the equivalent of this film.  But don't get we wrong, the opening credits are worth it, so go, and then leave after that.  The best part of the entire experience were the junior mints i was eating during the showing, once those were done, the rest was torture. The jokes were used and abused, and the plot twists and turns reached new rancid heights, even for an austin powers film.  Mike Myeres is a genius, but you can only take one joke so far.  Just watch the first film three times if you want a trilogy.  Be thankful the movie is only a meesly hour and a half, and remember the junior mints.

At first I thought that this would be as bad as the second one, but I was wrong. Very wrong. This movie has everything funny. It only has, like, a couple of stupid or bad scenes. But, it's great anyway. If you haven't seen this movie, you should see it!!**** 1/2 out of *****

Many problems with this one starting with the Toilet humor.  Most of which I found to be stupid.  Myers did okay but adding Goldmember just  made every other character that much weaker.  The ending was also pretty stupid. In my opinion this series should have stopped at 2. It was obvious that this movie had no point to it besides making the trillions of dollars that it did.Beyonce was okay for a first movie although she didn't impress me she didn't do a terrible job with what she had.  No chemistry was made between Austin and Foxy even though they had history.  There was just something wrong with this whole movie.The cameo's were okay I guess although didn't really have a purpose.  Tom Cruise and Gwyneth were good.  Devito was strange as usual.  I was very disappointed in the Britney Spears one where Austin basically humiliates her before blowing her head off.  Why would you do something so cruel as a cameo?Overall not a disgraceful movie.  Don't get me wrong not good either.  4 out of 10

Review title: Haven't laughed so hard in ... ever!
Review_body: Goldmember is, IMHO, the best of the three movies. No matter what anyone says, most of the jokes are laugh out loud funny, as it should be. Yes, some of them are getting a bit old [the sharks with the laaaserbeams, the guy-falling-off-the-chair bit, etc.] but most of it is PURE GOLD! I was laughing so hard I nearly fell off my chair at times. If you loved the first two, you'll love this one too.

Review title: Brilliant... isn't it time for Platinum baby?!
Review_body: Fabulous film, and thoroughly made the world we live in seem a happier place 😀 I think people need more of this kind of comedy to shine a light through our current political and interpersonal meltdown...Austin Powers in Goldmember makes you laugh like before you mistrusted people, and smile like before you first looked behind the curtain.Class act... please make more 😄

Austin Powers 3 was hilarious. It is extremely entertaining and I laughed all the time. There are some new interesting characters including the latest villain Goldmember, also played by Mike Myers, Cleopatra, a foxy sidekick of Austin's, and Austin's equally horny father Nigel. There is also a cameo of Britney Spears in which she performs a dance-off with Austin. But there are still the same hilarious characters including Fat Bastard, Mini-Me, Dr.Evil with his quirky buddies, and more. If you've seen the first two Austin Powers movies, you must see this one because it is the funniest one of all. Plus, there is a huge surprise ending that is too good to say. I recommend this movie for anyone up for tons of comedy.

This film is simply not funny! Not even remotely. Its a series of cliché after cliché and the punch lines are immediately predictable and therefore dull. The biggest flaws are in the characters. Here you have a film where so much of the comedic appeal depends on its characters, yet the characters are in fact the same ones from the previous film and the one before that; characters we have over familiarized ourselves with.This style of comedy is a little dated. The first one was hysterical and the second almost, but this one just does not work, not so much because it doesn't want to but because there is no contextual connection with the audience unless your a 13 year old and you happen to like Britney Spears.If you're an intelligent person however and you actually do have a sense of humor, you will just be thoroughly insulted by how someone over there in Hollywood actually believes he can make someone like you laugh.In short, its nothing more than an ineffectual pile of rubbish. Oh yeah and its quite boring too.

When I first saw Goldmember, I thought it was the weakest of the three movies. However, I bought all 3 films on DVD. Having watched them again and upon reflection, I have actually come to consider the third movie the best. It's much more solid than the second, and the laughs are more frequent than the original. Recommended scenes: 1) The dance sequence that breaks out following the filming of the "movie" in the opening, 2) The shadow-play in the submarine doctor's office,3) The flashback with young Austin, young Dr. Evil, young Basil, and young No. 2 in boarding school, and 4) Any scene with Beyoncé Knowles--she is absolutely magnetic.Honestly, the laughs don't stop. And, yeah, a lot of it's potty humor. Who cares? It's effective potty humor. Relax, give in to it, and enjoy!

Review title: This is the funniest movie I have seen in a long time.
Review_body: This movie has something for everyone.  This movie has everything and everybody in it if even for a while.  It is so cleverly directed and good natured fun.  There is a joke for every race creed and country of origin. It is a fine example of an American Movie. I wish they could give it a special Oscar!

Review title: Did they run out of funny?
Review_body: I hope you liked the jokes from the first two movies A LOT 'cause if you don't you won't like this movie at all.  There are about three new jokes in the entire movie (after the opening which is unbelievably funny), and those feel old too especially after being bombarded with clips on Comedy Central and in advertisements.  Well I'd say skip this one but most people will see it anyway (as I did), and the intro is worth seeing before you hear too much more about it.  Just don't be looking for any of the comic revelations of the previous Mike Meyers movies, actually this does feel like Wayne's World 2 (but not as good!!), with it's repetitions from the other movies.  Just go in expecting little and you'll won't be disapointed.  And someone start around the petition to prevent Mike from making another one...please.

The writers did a good job retaining the ongoing themes yet keeping the jokes fresh.  Considering it's the third movie, it's excellent relative to other sequels.  The opening was well done and very funny.  Tons of Cameos. Music is good.  The ending was disappointing - very unlike the previous two. The movie never quite reached a climax so it's unfair to say the ending was anti-climatic.  Nonetheless it's a funny movie and well worth the time.

This film offers nothing new if you've seen one Austin you've seen them all. The only reason I saw this was for Michael Caine. This film was dreadful.  I would rather watch a double feature of Ishtar and Spies Like Us Than to have to endure this or god forbid a fourth Austin Powers Film.

I have to admit that the previews for the third Austin Powers movie did not do it justice.  I was afraid to spend $8 to find out for sure too.  But the humor continues, winning back my confidence in the opening sequence even. A must see for Powers lovers, and comedy lovers, no matter what your gut feeling may be saying.  A worthy sequel!

I saw a pre-screening of "Austin Powers in Goldmember" today (22/07/02) and it was a howl.  Mike Myers outdid himself, playing four roles (as opposed to two in "International Man of Mystery" and three in "The Spy Who Shagged Me."  I suppose he'll play five parts in the next sequel.  The opening of "Goldmember" is worth the price of admission and be sure to stick around for the 'cookies' during the closing credits

Myers and company aren't even trying anymore. There are so many things that are just plain lazy and wrong about this film, I can't wait for someone to fill out the "goofs" section on it (what's with the friggin' bright blue eyes, can someone tell me? there's even a clip of the first AP for comparison, for chrissakes). And what was so funny about the other two was that stupid inconsistencies were made fun of and joked about - not so in this case. There also seems to be a somewhat bored, mean-spiritedness pervading the movie, but this may just be a symptom of Myers's boredom. And the cameos slathered on (especially the last-minute Osbornes shtick) cannot make up for a very empty waste of $9.

The latest installment of the Austin Powers saga has many funny moments, and there is much hard-laughing.  And there are no "bad moments" (unlike other films).  The biggest problem is that I was expecting more, and expecting that the laughter would be constant.  It was not, but still overall this is an excellent film.

Review title: AP Has Degenerated into a Gross-Out Movie!
Review_body: I liked the first 2 AP movies, but this one was awful.  All it is now is a disgusting gross-out movie that isn't worth seeing and has no business being rated PG-13.  Is this really the best Mike Meyers can do??  If it is, I feel sorry for him.

I thought Goldmember was disjointed and patchy. Good in places, but unfunny and self-indulgent in others. The weakest of the three Austin Powers movies in my humble opinion. And the end suggested that Austin Powers 4 (`Flogging a Dead Horse`?) will not be too far away.

Review title: One too many times to the well.
Review_body: Myers went to the well one too many times. After the first half hour the potty humor gets extremely old. The funny lines from the second movie are no longer funny in this one. The cameos add a little, but very little. By the end of the film, I did not care what was happening with the empty plot. Austin Powers gives new meaning to beating a dead horse.

Review title: Tries so hard to make it funny that its just the cringiest thing I have every seen. Bad jokes, Austin powers and gold member have very bad acting.
Review_body: Not recommended, bad movie. Not funny or entertaining, quite the opposite. don't watch it, it really makes me cringe like never before. The whole thing is dissapointing. I watched unknowingly that it would be such a poor way to spend my time, I would've rather wanted to work, at least that is productive. The producers, directors, script writers, and actors I feel did a poor job on the movie.

Review title: If you like the kind of humour, you'll love it
Review_body: For me personal the humour was too simple. But if you like it, it's definitally your kind of movie. The people around me in the cinema were laughing their heads of :-]. Austin Powers has to battle Dr. Evil once again and this time he has unexpected help...

I'm probably the world's biggest Austin Powers fan and I've loved the shagadelic swinger and his nemesis Dr Evil from the opening day of the original Austin Powers movie so I was very much excited by the news of a third Austin Powers movie.When The Spy Who Shagged Me was released, it hurt me to watch it not because it was crap - because it was so funny. It was witty, clever, smart and most importantly - RUDE. So with my expectations very high for the third outing for Powers and co., I watched it at a private screening and this is what I thought...After a very impressive opening five minutes involving more A-List talent than a Robert Altman film, the movie slowly starts going downhill as "gag" after "gag" fails to hit the mark and the only jokes that do work were already done in the previous two AP films.Don't get me wrong though. This movie is far from being bad and some people I watched it with loved it. But I didn't. I tried to love it but I just couldn't.I hated Fat Bastard. I despised Goldmember. Dr. Evil was under-used and Austin Powers just wasn't as rude as he used to be. The second AP was filled with sexual innuendo but this movie had only a handful of decent "I can't belive he said that" moments. I was also quite bitter that Heather Graham didn't turn up for a cameo appearence as she is simply forgotten about in this movie.Beyonce Knowles was very good (and damn fine!) as Foxy Cleopatra but the material which she had to work with didn't give her the opportunity to shine as the great comic actress that she seems she can be.I could go on and on about things I didn't like about this movie, but I don't want to get anyone down about it before they've had a chance to see it. Go see it. It's worth the price of a ticket - you just might need to think twice before buying the DVD though...P.S. Mike Myers, if you're reading this, I love your work so don't hate me. I'm going to write a forth Austin Powers movie and fantasise that may be, one day, it'll get made.Peace.

The first 2 minutes are hilarious, but after that, it barely encourages a smile. The jokes are recycled and make you cringe. How they got so many big stars to appear in this film is beyond me. Stick with the first two, don't bother with this one. 0 out of 5.

Saw this at a free preview and it was so bad a refund would have been appropriate.  Yes- some funny bits but the character of Goldmember was so unfunny it was almost embarrassing to watch. I saw this at a packed theater with a young enthusiastic crowd and there was almost no laughter. If this is the cut that made it to screen it would be interesting to see the stuff that they axed-- how bad was it?

Review title: Two Horny Spy's, Japinese Twins, and plenty of jokes about the dutch, what more could u want?
Review_body: Auston Powers in Goldmember was a great movie. Now I know What I'm saying. It doesnt fall into the ranks of stuff like A Clockwork Orange, Goodfellas Or the Godfather parts 1 and 2 but its still a tight little cute comedy. Mike Myers out does himself playing 4 title characters "Auston Powers", "Dr. Evil", Fat Bastard", and "Goldmember" I saw it first on opening night and loved it so much. Then i saw it again last night and I laughed harder. Its filled with one liners that u will love. *Minor Spoiler* (But I didnt like the part when fat Bastard farts and every one burst into laughter comone were not 4 here.) But otherwise I strongly suggest u see Goldmember.

Review title: This movie was a huge disappointment...
Review_body: I was extremely disappointed with this movie. I saw it the first weekend it came out and was expecting a smartly written comedy and was severely disappointed. The whole movie was just a redoing of the other two. There were no new jokes, no new twists-- nothing. There were no redeeming qualites of this movie that I could think of. The villian in the movie, Goldmember, was just plain nuts, not a smartly written funny villian like Dr.Evil. I would not waste my money on this movie if I had to do it over again.

I didn't think it could be done, but the third movie funnier that the first and the second??!! WOW!! Mike Myers is genious!! He has surrounded himself with a great cast to work with and a production staff that must have the most fun on the job ever! Jay Roach...two things...Genious Comic Director...and wifey Susanna Hoffs...LUCKY MAN!!...MAN!! Please tell me there is a fourth (forth-coming), if only George Lucas could evolve this way.

We'll he is back again in theaters this time Mike Myers has droped to new levels of humor to keep the story alive.  Although most of the movie I could not stay in my seat from laughter, I felt there were a lot of dead scenes where not much was going on.  There is a lot of potty hummor is this movie and is not a great movie for those who are sensetive of that kind of humor. Although it was a great movie I think I'll save my money and rent it when it gets on DVD.

You have to go into these AP movies knowing you are going to be treated with mindless humor. That being said I have to say this was a bit too much re-tread to be enjoyable.I was expecting to be sore from laughing - and it started out great. The whole opening scene was a surprise and had me hysterical. From there it was downhill. If Tom Cruise is the funniest part of a movie then you are in serious trouble.Yes, the movie had a few funny moments but nothing was sustained at all. I don't mind bringing good gags back but it seems like just about every joke is recycled. At least make some kind of effort to put some new GOOD gags into the film.I know the retread gags and the shlocky overused product placement (advertising) is supposed to be an inside joke but it all came across lame. The outright tailoring of much of the movie to the MTV crowd was totally weak. There were entire scenes that were meant to be funny where the theatre was in dead silence (ex. rap video).As I write this I am amazed that this film is listed as 7 star entertainment - maybe I saw a different movie. If this is going to be the level of effort for future AP films then I hope MM puts this puppy to rest.
Beyonce is a sight to behold but I am NOT feeling Randy, Baby!!! For the FEW good laughs in this movie I would give 3 stars.

If you howled (as I did) at THE SPY WHO SHAGGED ME, stick in the DVD and watch it again. The experience will be far better than seeing this "new" film made up of old gags. The theory seems to be that if several poopoo, teetee and fart jokes were funny, then ten times more of them will be ten times funnier. Uh-uh: it works in inverse proportion. The sole laugh-out-loud I had from this film was a piece of stock footage of a chimp falling out of a tree. The jokes telegraph themselves from miles away, the dialogue is horrible, and the plot...wait, what plot? On paper it would seem like a brainstorming session that no one bothered to write a first draft of. The shadow bit from SHAGGED ME is repeated, as is the bit with Dr. Evil's space ship/satellite/whatever being misidentified as giant body parts, and lots of other bits are rehashed as well. How in God's name is this getting the reviews it's been getting? Has our sense of humor sunk to such a dreadfully low level that we chortle at lists of euphemisms for male genitalia? To their credit, the audience I was with didn't laugh much either. Maybe you can't fool all of the people all of the time. I'd love to see word of mouth kill this puppy in the coming weeks. Ooo. Bad. So very very bad.

Review title: Bust a gut Laughs from Start to Finish!
Review_body: I saw this movie @ a sneak preview and I think I can say that everyone there laughed through the entire movie.  I didn't hear half of the dialoge because everyone was laughing too hard.  I will say that a lot of it was bathroom humor, right up there with "There's Something About Mary" but is that really so bad.  Some of the jokes in it are recycled from the first two, but done in a new enough way that they don't seem tired and old.  And some of them seem like they are inside jokes for the fans of the first ones.  One tip: If you plan on seeing it, don't let anyone tell you about the Cameos.  The surprise of who you are seeing is half of the joke.  This franchise has proved that the sequels can surpass the originals.

Review title: better than the first not as good as the second
Review_body:
The first 20 minutes or so was boring. My daughter and I waited for a long time for this installment and after 10 minutes we looked at each other and rolled our eyes. HOWEVER, it got better. There are some very funny scenes. Fat bastard wasn't in it as much as I hoped and the gold member character is kinda boring. Mini-me was very funny. Michael Caine was ok, not as funny as I had hoped, the cameos were pretty funny. Heather Graham was not in the movie they must have cut her out. Speilberg was pretty funny.
The movie pokes fun at everything, even itself as a sequel.

From the opening shots of the newest installment in the Austin Powers series it becomes apparent that much more money has been spent than in previous films.  It also becomes clear that jokes that seem like they'll be funny ultimately fall flat. Furthermore, jokes that seem like they'll fall flat from the beginning do in fact fall flat, and are then rammed in our faces at least three more times for us cringe.The film is loaded with potentially funny celebrity cameos.  It is also loaded with jokes that had no business making it through editing. (Austin: (After destroying a Fembot Britney Spears) Oops, I did it again.)Product placement runs wild through the film as well.Watching  `Goldmember' is for the most part tragically embarrassing.   It occurred to me about 20 minutes into the film that it didn't even seem like it was Mike Myers playing his characters, but rather someone who looked just like Mike Myers but could only do a sloppy impression.   Austin himself is immensely pathetic.  Dr. Evil seems to take on some strange Canadian traits. Fat Bastard...was dead, was he not? Well, anyway, he's annoying  here. And last and least is Goldmember, an annoying  and highly underdeveloped character. (How do we know he likes gold? Because he says he likes gold, that's it.) Other actors don't have much luck either. Beyonce Knowles does practically nothing as Foxy Cleopatra, although she admittedly seems like she could be fun.  Michael Caine is good with what he has, or I should say, what little he has.   Infact, the only consistently funny character is Mini Me, who is suprisingly hilarious in all of his scenes.Part of the problem may be that there are so many `things' the Powers movies always do, that this film is stifled by having to go out of its way to do them. A very unsatisfying series of `It's a (insert body part name here)' should have been cut, rather than kept only to keep with tradition.When the movie is funny, which does happen, it is very funny.  The rap with Dr. Evil and Mini Me in prison is hilarious, the fight between Austin and Mini Me is hilarious.  Some jokes about urination and childbirth are also particularly funny.  These rare moments don't come closing to making up for the general schlock-ish feel of the film.  This Austin Powers is unfunny, predictable and utterly forgettable.

I didn't mind the first installment Austin Powers, but in my opinion, it wasn't the funniest thing I'd ever seen. The second one was a lot funnier, and #3 is very funny, Mini-Me stole the show for me, violent slap stick humour at its best :-)

I've only cried more at a movie once, and that was Schindlers List! I've never laughed so hard at a movie - I couldn't stop!!Mike Myers certainly deserves to be named #1 comedian by E! Goldmember was a little gross, but it was great to see Mini Me and Scott doing more plot-wise. Can't wait for #4!!!

Review title: 1 was good, 2 was o.k... 3 was amazing
Review_body: This morning I went to see "Austin Powers 3: Goldmember" and to say the least about it; it was amazing. I couldn't stop laughing from the opening until the closing of the movie. Even the very beginning, and the very very end were funny. I don't recall any boring parts of the movie. This is a great movie, clearly the best Austin Powers one so far. Mike Myers did an incredible job playing the role of 4 characters. The whole idea with the movie being made about Austin Power was hilarious. Especially since they used Tom Cruise, Gwyneth Paltrow, and Danny DeVito. (sorry about my spelling mistakes, if any.) Well to end this, I'd like to recommand this movie to any person that likes to laugh. Especially Austin Powers fans.

Kevin Spacey and Danny Devito give great laughs at the beginning of the movie playing Dr. Evil & Mini Me.. Guess who plays which character =) But the movie is great in general, thou i miss the shot that were taken with Liz Hurley, she is just such a fox.

Goldmember isnt as good as the other 2 Austin Powers films. The jokes seem very strained, and apart from a few funny bits, especially a piece in the doctors office, the film never entertains as often as the others. The Goldmember character just doesnt work, Austin Powers himself seems to be struggling badly for any new gags leaving the still brilliant Dr Evil and Mini Me to offer the only funny parts. Although the plot was never the biggest part of these films, Mike Myers seems to have hit a complete dead end. Michael Caine isnt funny, Beyonce does her best in a part that allows little opportunity to be funny. The Fat Bastard character should have been left out, and the name dropping and product placement is way over the top. The opening scene contains a number of famous people such as Tom Cruise, Kevin Spacey and Britney Spears but the musical opening just doesnt work. I thought the film was poor. The jokes have ran dry. Mike Myers needs to move on because he is better than trying out old jokes again.

Review title: Fun, but not as good as the first two
Review_body: From the start of the movie it felt like it was just missing something.  I really enjoyed the cameo filled opening but felt that the movie was just a string of cameos and product placement advertising.  Maybe I just came in with high expectations.  There were some funny jokes however and many entertaining moments.  Great performances overall by the whole cast and Michael Caine was exceptionally great.  It didn't feel like there was much new humor-wise to this movie compared to the other two, but it definitely had its exceptionally funny and entertaining moments.  This movie will not hold up and be as timeless as the other two, but nonetheless is an important part of the ongoing(hopefully) Austin Powers saga.

The first two movies in this series were quite hillarious but the joke seems to have stretched to far. What set the first two movies out were the unpredictable humor. However, mini-me's defection and the discovery that austin and evil were brothers was pretty sad. Throughout the movie I sat there for long periods of time, waiting for a joke. The subtitle joke was not funny.Overall, a poor version of the first two Austin powers movies. Hopefully, this will be the last. 4/10

Review title: Mike Myers is a frigin' genius, Yeah, Baby!
Review_body: Mike is pure genius. Students of film could use the A.P. trilogy to study comedy and or sequel writing. Not a second of celluloid goes by that is not important to complete the movie. The movie could have ended after the opening number and I would have gone home happy. Like it's predecessors, "Goldmember" begins with a Broadway-like production. This time it's bigger and better than ever.  A hell of a grabber. Being number three is hard to pull off. The movie humbles itself with obviously blatant yet unashamed reprisals of characters and skits from the two previous A.P. movies. However, by delving further and further into the world of Austin Powers Myers reveals a masterpiece of a world present only in his mind and on film, thank goodness. Watching "Goldmember" was fun. So many guest appearances I got lost. Ahhh, what a fun movie. You know that those guest stars were thinking," Man-o-man, and I get paid for doing this, too!" I mean John Tavolta dances in "Goldmember", aint that great!Mike Myers is a frigin' genius.

Review title: Well contrived jokes make for some great laughs, but at the expense of a cheesy ending.
Review_body: For all of those Austin Power's fans, Mike Myer's third installement of the loveable swingin' Brit will make another great fix.  Chalk full of puns and reliably funny spoofs of classic films, Austin Powers in Goldmember, whose title is already a spoof off of the James Bond classic Goldfinger, will bring out the best of laughs in a night of movie going.  Although some critics towted Goldmember's jokes as overdone and the new character's unnecessary, apart from some choppy bridges in the script which seem to be there to move the script in some direction, the jokes seemed genuine and effortless. A lot of what was found hysterical and whitty in the first Austin Powers and in its sequel were matched and fleshed out even further in the latest. Verne Troyer as mini-me and Seth Green as Dr. Evil's son, Scott Evil, were explored more deeply and as a result the "father-son bond" which has been explored this summer was brought out here as well. New characters Floxxy Cleopatra, played by Beyonce Knowles, was a great addition, as she easily wins as Austin's most supportive female counterpart (shying away from the ditsy Barbie doll image scultped by Felicity Shagwell in The Spy Who Shagged Me).  Michael Caine as Niegl Powers is as enjoyable as it can be to see Caine as a swingin' superficial father, and Austin as his new character Goldmember is cheeky but more enjoyable to watch than Fat Bastard. Overall Mike Myer's latest sequel to Austin Powers is as enjoyable as one could expect.  Although this movie appears to have more of its script centered on making spoofs of classic dramas and films to bring it some depth, the swingin' attitude and laughs are still enough to make this a film to see in the theater.

Review title: Better than the original, very much in line with the 2nd.
Review_body: Very good movie if you like the characters from the previous movies. Good cameo appearances, similar plot with similar characters with new jokes and full of laughs, again, highly recommended if you thought the other movies were worth your buck.

Absolutely hysterical!!!loved it.  Much better than the second Austin Powers.  Laughed in parts til we cried-worth paying full price!!Lots of surprises.Most of the original cast are back.  Mike Meyers writing is very funny.  There is adult humor, and if you have small kids, this probably isn't the movie for them.

Half way through the movie Ozzy calls all of the producers boobs and points out that the movie is just using all of the same jokes from the last two installments.  How true!  How True!  I can't believe I wasted $8 on this when i could have paid that to rent the other two and a couple of good films.  Worst movie ever--ranks up there with The One and with Jason X.

Review title: This movie is the best of all three!
Review_body: This movie is great and I really liked it just like all of the others.  If that kind of comedy amuses you this is the movie for you.  This movie was as good as the others if not the best.  I consider this one my favorite of all three.  The jokes are the same and among the same lines as the others. Although, I didn't care for the goldmember character the movie was great. Go see this movie if you want a good laugh!As I proved for myself the critics are wrong.  The movie is a definite must see!Craig

Review title: I fell out of my seat laughing so hard ... really!
Review_body: What can I say other than I loved the opening sequence (no spoilers here). It took me by complete surprise. And the water fountain scene made me laugh so hard I slipped off my seat. It took me a good minute to compose myself. That is how funny I found it and many many other scenes. The movie is bursting with great one liners.And is it just me or does Mike have a great knack for placing pop culture icons at key moments! Go Ozzie go!I think Mike has left a great opening for another Austin Powers or at least a prequel with all the younger versions! Think about it! Dr. Evil, Austin, Basil and #2 at age 18!Warning: If you don't like potty jokes you should stay away! But you are really missing out on something special.Thanks Mike! I gave you a 9 out of 10! Fantastic for a comedy!PS: Stay for the outtakes at the end of the movie!John

Review title: One of the best movies ever made
Review_body: In this Austin Powers movie, Dr. Evil is planning to destroy the artic places on earth, while getting help from a new bad guy named Goldmember, who kidnaps his dad. This is a great movie, and you should go see it.

It's not often that you find yourself laughing out loud throughout an entire movie, and it's even less often that everyone else in the theater is laughing along with you. Goldmember is a non-stop giggle fest that will have you squirting your favourite carbonated beverage out your nose, and finding that your inability to remain still has emptied your popcorn all over yourself and the unfortunate person in front of you. It is immediately apparent how much thought and preparation went into this movie after seeing the opening scene, which the series is famous for. While Goldmember does sometimes seem to re-use jokes, I saw them as references to the previous movies that only increased the enjoyment for the Austin Powers fan. If you're looking for a movie filled with pseudo British comedy, over the top sexual innuendos coming out the rear end and dozens of celebrity cameos then this is your movie. Thanks Mike Myers. I've been your fan since Wayne's World and I knew you were destined for greatness. -tgc

Austin Powers: The Goldmember is the worst movie I have ever seen.  Mike Myers is a talented guy, with great humor and willing to share with the public.  But, I think he had use his humor in a wrong way. I felt like wasting an hour or so of my time watching some agents trying to get the golden key back so the world wont be flooded.

Review title: it can't be worse LOOK OUT!
Review_body: Just saw Goldmember. Disgusting! Not funny. Any of it.All product placement and low low low level of humor. Complete waste of time. All gags seem to be regurgitated from other films. What does thisremind me of? A very bad Saturday Night Live skit from the bad years. I've seen a lot of great films, some masterworks. This is so far off the scale, I would only call it a complete waste of film. True humor can be great, This is Awful. What happened to Hollywood?A film lover

wonderful! the amount of cameos in this movie is totally amazing, i believe the end of this movie could be something you will never forget, just look at fat bastard, go and see this movie now! i dont care if your 1/2 awake, it will be one of the movies that gets played every year at christmas!

Dear Mr Myers,I highly respect your work, but if you want to write a bunch of unrelated sketches, please go back to SNL: the world doesn't need more of this kind of garbled writing passed off as feature film.It's painful to see the franchise that began with your hilarious original outing, with all elements of story, being reduced to a 'random task' where any old joke will do, despite it's effect on things like plot and character.And speaking of character, you've got far too many competing for screen time: the whole world of Austin Powers has been completely overblown, and is heading toward the embarrassing convoluted realm of Casino Royale.See to it that you correct these shortcomings in your next venture, as I suspect there will be, as it's clear you've got a bad case of Sequelitis.

Review title: The Golden Boy from SNL strikes again!!! Gold that is.
Review_body: Mike Myers has done it again with his third installment of Austonian comedy. Austin Powers 3 Goldmember, is more risque than the previous Power movies, with a submarine stuffed full of characters sharing the spotlight with Myers. Be prepared to laugh until you cry. This film has it all. With unexpected cameos and family trees that could confuse a geneticist. Beware of the Kickstand.

Review title: Should be called Minnie-Me in Goldmember
Review_body: In this third installment of Austin Powers, one character shines through as the best: Minnie-Me!  Getting twice as much screen time as he did in The Spy Who Shagged Me, Verne Troyer's performance in this film is superb!  He is so funny when he becomes, "Minnie-Austin"!

This movie is by far the funniest movie i  have ever seen. It is a bit nastier then the first 2, but the comedy makes up for it. This movie is a huge 100 out of 10. Beyonce is hot and funny, and mini-me is back and better then ever. Did I mention this movie is funny?

Review title: Greatest film I have ever seen!
Review_body: I saw Goldmember opening night, and I was definitely NOT disappointed. If you combine the first two movies and multiply by three, that's about half as funny as this one. Halfway through the movie I had a headache from laughing so hard. There were a few unexpected surprises to add to the astonishment of this movie. On a scale of 1-10, I give it 11.

I think it is ridicules that people are comparing this movie to the first two.  Yes, I realize that it is the third in a series, but give it a chance people.  This movie is hilarious!  If you had never seen the first two and watched this one, you would agree!  This is the problem with most movie critics.  Base your opinion off of the movie, not off of other movies. This movie is great in it's own right, and I laughed the entire time I watched it.  For all of you who say it wasn't as funny as the first two, go watch it again, and watch it as a movie, not as something to contend against something else...

Review title: At the risk of being Cliche..........ITS GROOVY BABY!!!!!
Review_body: The original AP is still one of the funniest films you'll ever see. I almost wet myself watching AP2 when it came out. I'd say Gold Member is probably the best film of the three, even though I didnt laugh as much this time round. The reason for that is that "we're" so familiar with jokes that they're expected and if you are an Austin fan like me you'll know what I mean. Not that thats a bad thing - It's kind of comfortable. The jokey bits are better than before, most of it is just downright clever. It's worth watching the film just for the cameos. It shows that some of the biggest stars in the world have a sense of humour and can take a dig at themselves. Michael Caine is perfect as Austin's dad - just by being himself - no make up was required :) Mini-me is ace as he "develops" - wont spoil it - you'll see.To the uninitiated, Austin Powers is a real p*** take of the spy genre films, especially James Bond. Just imagine James Bond being played and written by Dick Emery and you're nearly there - except Mike Myers is in my opinion far more entertaining and clever than the great Emery ever was. If you liked the Waynes World stuff you'll be an Austin fan I promise.People either love or hate Austin films. If you've never seen an Austin film, get the first one out on video, then the second one before you see Goldmember. OD on Austin people - Its shagtastic!!!!

Weak Plot  and love interest- so what- my sides were splitting I could not catch my breath and I was in tears. The cameo's rocked! I couldn't stop laughing.  Raunchy, yes- crude you bet- only Mike Myers can get away with this much potty humor!!  I laughed my a** off.

I have never left a movie in the middle of it, until now. This is perhaps one of the worst movies i have ever seen.  I liked the first one because it was original, and could be inappropriate and raunchy without actually being bad. In this film, they stop at nothing to get a laugh, and for me none of them worked and only made me cringe in disgust. They had no problem in saying "balls" and "nuts", and Fat Bastard describing how he left a piece of excrement and a bad smell in his sumo rag. I say plotless because i never actually saw a plot emerge through the thirty minutes i viewed. I suppose there was a plot after i left, but that is a little late for me.  During the 30 minutes i watched the film, I saw 2 families leave with their childern. I'm not sure if they were leaving because it was too bad for their kids, or it was too bad in general, either way I wouldn't be surprised.

Review title: Austin POWers 3... i hope they make 5-6 more at least
Review_body:
Please support Austin Powers 3 so that we will get another comedic masterpiece in the form of Austin Powers 4OK... Austin Powers 3 was funny funny funny and smart... it was full of awesomeness... Mike Meyers really went out on a limb with the comedy and dialogue in this movie... he didn't stick to standard comedy like "i've got a whole bag of shh" though many don't consider that standard anyways... so i should say, HIS standard Austin Powers comedy... let me quote one of the hundreds of funny lines in this new movie to give you an idea: "Moley Moley Moley!"go see it you won't be sorry... honestly.. its really good... its sooo good... Mike Meyers takes his own characters and continues to amaze me with his range of facial expressions for each one...OH YEAH.. don't forget about Jay Roach who co-directed not only Austin Powers 1 and 2 but also the masterpiece that is Meet the Parents... The guy has only directed 5 movies but he is now one of my favorite directors... i will be waiting to see if he will direct the meet the parents sequel and if he is/does, i will be anticipating another great sequel...
see austin powers 3 for yourself... because you like austin powers 1 and 2... not because every says austin powers 3 is a good movie.. if you don't have the background (how many people don't anymore though?) then you won't appreciate it as much.. .sure it will be strange and funny... but the real joy is seeing the progression the austin powers saga from its origins to it's second and very good sequel... be aware, this is a sequel to austin powers 2, not the first austin powers... some of you know what i am talking about...by the way i am going to go watch it about 2-3 more times in the next week or so... -it is 7/29/02 when i write this.

Goldmember is not nearly as good as the previous 2 films in the series. Anyone who tells you it is has not seen the movie, or has very low standards!  It is, on the whole, not funny. Wait for home video release!

The best Austin Powers yet. Mike Myers is a genius. It has some really funny parts. Especially the beginning and the Dr. Evil and Mini Me rap scene. This is a great movie. GO SEE IT.
this is movieman2007. farewell.

Review title: If you liked the other Austin Powers movies, you'll probably love this one, but if you thought number one or two were a little over the top, then save your money, this one will gross you out in ways you neve
Review_body:
Mike Myers took our favourite shagadellic spy and went to the next level.It has relatively little storyline, barely any taste (well, actually, no taste if I'm being quite honest), characters that make you cringe, and a host of famous cameos that are thrown in there without any recourse to a plot - in short, it was a laugh-a-minute addition to the Austin Powers tradition of Anglo-Canadian humour consisting mainly of jokes about genitalia and a facial mole on the top lip of the grown-up boy in the Wonder Years, Fred Savage. Beyonce Knowles (from Destiny's Child, but don't hold that against her) did a fantastic Foxy Cleopatra who's only downfall, sadly, was that she wasn't in the movie enough for my liking !!
Sufficed to say, if you liked the other Austin Powers movies, you'll probably love this one, but if you thought number one or two were a little over the top, then save your money, this one will gross you out in ways you never thought imaginable !!

Review title: Lots of laughs - Myers has it down
Review_body: I just saw the movie today.  I have seen the first two of the series and I have to say the plot here left me disappointed.  I know, it's a spoof, it's a slapstick comedy -this ain't CINEMA - but still, I would have enjoyed a better story.On the other hand, good lord, I laughed too hard!!!  Mike Myers is definitely the most talented SNL alum of recent times.  The cameos are fantastic and casting Michael Caine as Austin's father worked perfectly.If you want to laugh out loud (a lot) and you don't need to be bothered with plot, don't miss it.

A big fan of the first two Austin Powers movies, I felt that this third installment wasn't nearly as funny nor did it have much of a plot. Sure it had some hilarious moments, but overall it didn't even compare with its predecessors. For me, any movie that is under 90 minutes is either a kids movie, or just not worth seeing. Just a coincidence I guess. I've seen the movie listed as being 2:13 long but I timed it at 1:28.I realize that Mike Meyers did this show as a tribute to his father, but for the type of shows the first two Austin Powers movies were about, this one seemed rather sappy. I respect the love and affection he had for his real father, but it just didn't play well in a bathroom humor type of comedy. Not to give it away, but the ending was completely awful. Perhaps this is it for the Austin Powers series. One thing I will give it...the makeup is incredible. They did a terrific job with Goldmember. I can't see Mike Meyers in him at all.

THE movie was great. I dont think i ever laughfed so much in my life. New to Austin Powers movies..i didn't expect it to be too funny cause my friends told me the second one was the best mivie ever...i got a new favorite movie.

As far as Austin Powers movies go, I can say that this movie was almost a stroke of brilliance(again, only by Austin Powers movies terms.) The only reason I think that I didn't give this movie a perfect ten,(I gave it a nine,) is only because the ending was quite obvious. The other 2 I loved also but not as much. By ratings terms, I'd give them each an 8. Still I loved all three, but I beleive that a 4th wouldn't be a great idea. And couldn't be as successful as the three existing titles. For those who saw the movie they will know what I mean.

Review title: Save your money and watch the 2nd movie again!
Review_body: P.T. Barnum was right about a sucker being born every minute.  I now see why they've been constantly marketing this thing to death.  They've recycled all the best jokes from the last movie.  They added very little new material and the paper thin plot gets really tedious after a while.  Then, they have the gall to rub your nose in the fact that you actually paid to see this film(Ozzy Osbourne segment).  I expected more from Mike Myers.

Review title: Funny in places but disappointing overall
Review_body: Went to see this expecting the film to be better than the other two... but unfortunately I didn't find this to be the case.There are funny jokes, but there seems to be a fair amount of re-used material. The main thing that's missing is the set-piece scenes of the other two. The storyline is also somehow a bit weaker, and there's less spoofing of the genre.Enjoyable, but I think you'll be disappointed!

Review title: More of the same, but still good
Review_body: The third installment of the Austin Powers 'trilogy' to date can be said to be more of the same as the first two installments, but it is still entertaining if you enjoyed the others.Personally, I thought that the movie started a little slowly, but interestingly with its parody movie being shown.  However, the tempo picked up and there were some very big laughs in the second half.An interesting revelation at the end of the movie, albiet perhaps a little unbelieveable.Overall, I rated it an 8 and recommend viewing to any true Austin Powers fans.

I found that Goldmember really had "mojo" in this sequel to the Austin Powers trilogy.  I also find it very creative that the writers are able to take titles from Bond films and twist it into something quite humorous and would be up the alley of any swinger.It is hard to believe that all of the characters that Mike Myers portrays are really him.  Each one has such a different personality, that only a multi-talented person such as Myers could pull it off.  Austin Powers still knocks them dead in this movie.  Dr. Evil is back and is still as funny as ever.  Fat Bastard returns with his disgusting characteristics that are so gross, you have to laugh.  Myers' newest character Johan Van Der Smut, aka Goldmember doesn't totally cut it.  He just wasn't funny.I found that Beyonce Knowles was rather sexy in Goldmember.  But the whole "sugar" quote that she would constantly use got rather annoying quite quickly.  Michael Caine was absolutely hilarious.  He fit the whole swinging spy part, and even gave off a fatherly vibe.  He was wonderful.I have to recommend this movie for anyone who likes to laugh.  If you do not laugh at this movie, then you have some problems.  Check yourself into a proctologist and relieve yourself, because this movie is FUNNY!

As a rule, I expected this to be worse than the other Austin Powers movies but found myself laughing just as much if not more!  Although the plot didn't seem that good (even though of course it's not really necessary in a movie like this!) the characters were excellent!  I thought Mike Myers was brilliant as the four characters he plays!  And Verne Troyer and Seth Green as Mini-Me and Scott Evil were better than ever!

Review title: Not as good as the others
Review_body: Austin Powers in Goldmember was definetly not as good as the other two. Goldmember was very funny and had a pretty good plot though it reused jokes from the last movie. The movie overall was okay. If it was just another movie that wasn't a sequel it would have been better. Since it was a sequel, I expected more from it. This movie just didn't have what I expected.Pros: Goldmember had an extreamly funny and cleverly directed beginning. Very funny.Cons: Reused Jokes. Plot was pretty good, but not as good as I thought it would be.Overall: 3 out of 5 stars

Review title: I actually subscribed to IMDB to tell the world about this movie...
Review_body: What a waste of 30 bucks! I cannot believe how bad this movie was considering how clever the first two were. In fact, the first two films are so much a part of my life that I regularly quote them in my daily interactions (pathetic as that is).I went into Goldmember wanting to love it and what was presented was (painfully) recycled jokes with a few bellylaughs (due to the occasional original joke in-between). It's obvious that the whole group who put out this turkey got lazy, full of themselves and self-indulgent. I swear, if one more person mugged for the camera, I was going to scream. And by the way, whoever edited this thing should be shot because it was choppy and flowed about as well as nitro-glycerin in an earthquake.I hope this is the last edition of Austin Powers because it's obvious that the franchise has run its course. Save your money. I would say don't even bother with the DVD.Feh! Pee-yew!

I wasn't really looking forward to watching this movie because I am not a huge fan of the series. Some friends dragged me to the movie and I have never laughed so hard in my life. This movie was awesome and the one liners make you double over. You must see this movie!!!!

I was holidaying on a TV-less island when this film came out and i was so looking forward to watching it. So when I finally did watch it I was very disappointed at how many cameo appearances there were by celebrities. The best thing about the first two was that almost everyone in the films had a legitimate role. But this one had celebrities everywhere and had nothing to do with the storyline. It seemed as though the success of the film was riding on these celebrities.Besides that, I loved it. The way Mike Myers can play four different characters in the one film is amazing. He is an exceptional actor and writer.

Dont even wait till video..this movie was horrible..Same ole Lame fart jokes..cmon Hollywood get an original idea for once. Even Fat Bastard wasnt that funny... Not only was this the worst of all 3 movies..it ranks up there with the worst movies ever made.
Beyonce is a great actress, surprisingly, However, the movie was disappointing. The ending was not satisfying, while there were only some good moments.Still very enjoyable, just nothing great.

Review title: Only for people who like overplayed jokes.
Review_body: The basic plot of this movie makes no sense.  But at least they did us the curtesy of covering it up with overplayed jokes. Don't get me wrong, I loved #1 and #2 but 3 was simply a regurgitated copy of the previous "Powers" movies only mushed into a different order.  The casting, although it was much the same, was both good and bad.  Personally the previous leading ladies well exceeded Beyonce Knowles by a far shot. The more I tryed to understand it's stupidity the more I realized I wasted a perfectly good night on a perfectly awful movie.

Flashy, Funny, and Favorable when compared the the previous two installments.Austin Powers is pitted against Dr. Evil yet again to save his father (Caine) with the aid of Foxxy Cleopatra (Knowles). Michael Caine is a great addition to the series and brings a great amount of credibility to the character, not to mention the resemblance. Beyonce's performance is adequate, and Seth Green's character has a bit of a larger role, though I wish it was bigger because he is hilarious as Evil's son. Let's not forget to mention Fred Savage as "The Mole", a funny character that they made sure not to show us too often so the mole joke never dies. There are great cameos and an excellent production design (Evil's new submarine lair is by far the best).Bottom line is, if you like comedies that aren't dark or just plain silly, you'll like this movie because it is somewhere in between.

Review title: You saw the 2 previous ??? you already saw the good parts
Review_body: I thought it could be as good as austin power #2 but this is really... boring. Not there are no good moments, but as said, it's exactly the same (good and bad) jokes made in the two previous !!!! Now this is the third, so you get the obviously "all hollywood superstars" making cameo like "hey, I'm not so serious and borring: look, I'm here", and don't forget all 'cliché' you may expect, and more. For the plot it's simple : there is none... whatever, many people want to see the same thing so let's do it, production same money while getting ours.Conclusion : don't even waste the renting, for a good moment you better watch the previous one again.

Review title: objective, perhaps even subjective, comments from a fan
Review_body: With hindsight, I think I had an over-developed sense of excitement about this movie. I'd enjoyed the first two which I saw as a back to back double header - imagine that! Anyway, it was probably unrealistic to expect that the standard could possibly be maintained when the same characters are required to come up with a new and bizarre storyline, the third time around. OK, it wasn't quite up to scratch but, nevertheless, I had a few good laughs - it was worth the money, but don't expect to double up with laughter; be happy to be mildly amused. Signing-off, your reviewer, Richard.

Review title: I wanted to like it, really I did.
Review_body: I saw both of the first Austin Powers movies and really liked them. After seeing goldmember, I forget why. The movie was boring. The cameos were irritating and unnecessary. I noticed a lot of things that were supposed to be funny, but only laughed on a few occasions. I remember hearing from some of my friends that it was quite funny, but I really think I'll have to watch it again to see what other people laugh at, because i just did not enjoy it. Mike Meyers is tired, though has his moments as Austin, and Caine did decently well in a few scenes, but the movie as a whole failed. BTW, my tiredness upon viewing, accompanied by a hope that at some point the movie would improve, are the only things that kept me from fast-forwarding or stopping the movie. Ugh. I often caught myself staring at foxxy's cleavage, which was far more interesting than the actual movie most of the time. 3/10 for disappointment

I don't know how in the world did I sit even halfway through this movie, let alone through its etirety. A horrid amalgamation of wannabe-monty-python jokes, toilet humor, and mindless camp. I'm a fan of absurd and campy stuff (e.g. the Evil Dead movies), but come on. Mike Myers thinks that anyone can be funny simply by battering nonsense. It takes a lot of nerve NOT to be funny when parodying M:I-2. But I thought that it is virtually impossible if you can include Tom Cruise in a cameo! To my surprise, even that was accomplished in a brilliant fashion. And that is what this movie is about: an endless showcase of opportunities for a good laugh. He had it everything, and he flopped. Greatly. Only because of Beyonce (NOT the acting): 0.5\100

Review title: One of the best comedy ever
Review_body: This movie was great. It took all the funny things from the first two and put them into one movie. Mike Myers is just Great. This is one of his best works. All the jokes that Mike comes up are the great. If you only see one comedy in your life make it this one you. will be glad you saw it.

Back in 1997 Austin Powers came out and well it did good and the box-office and in 1999 the cheesy sequel appeared out of nowhere.Then there was this travesty of a film in 2002. The original had class,it was a fresh idea about a agent from the 60's frozen only to reapper in the 90's to fight his arch nemesis.Sure they jokes were'nt hilarious but they were original and being a spoof of James Bond,it contained subtle and unsubtle references to the series.Then "The Spy who Shagged Me" came out an it was okay.Now that Mike Myers played three characters there was a few more jokes and Mini-me.Slowly the jokes became more desperate fart jokes(Although though one or two were humorous)until eventually the "Dr.Evil spaceship" came along and then I finally gave up on the film. "Goldmember" was the worst of the bunch(What with Beyonce Knowles involved)and there was even more dumb jokes one after another(Okay I did laugh at the spoof joke with Gwenyth Paltrow,Tom Cruise,etc.because that was funny).Unfortunatley it was by the time that Britney Spears appear I knew things were going to get worse(Oh where to start!) Firstly there was the whole "Daddy wasn't There crap" and suddenly theres the Fook sisters.Next was the school for secret agents which just happens to have all the main characters from the last two films oh! and whats this another time machine,an annoying guy with peeling skin(plus poor speech and constantly declaring "I'm dutch!!" a la european stereotypes).The we had to see a horrible rendition of "It's a hardknock life"(Ooh!!Isn't that Ben Savage and some cheap mole jokes),a disturbing scene in jail between Myers and Sterling(By the way the interragation scene with the subtitles,it was unnecessary for Beyonce to read them out loud),a unforgiving godzilla joke and a repeat of the "spaceship" joke mentioned earlier(Like we need The Osbournes cameo just to remind us that).Micheal Caine on the other hand plays his role very well as usual but dosn't save this excuse for a movie.Now with Seth Green as a possible villian and Demi Moore in talks I sleep more restless each night until this turkey(Please God!Just to teach them not to make more sequels)is out in the cinema.

When I first heard the movie was coming out, I couldn't wait to see it. Knowing how well both the the first and second one were done, I figure 3rd would be better because to me it seemed to get better and better. SOme things they left out that made me cry (exagerating) were Mustafa character, the unnecessary slow death, the "zip-it" and "shhh" cycle, many others that were in the first and second one that wern't in the third one.The plot was okay in the middle, but the surprise ending was incredibly foolish. To me, the third one was completely out of place in the Austin Power series. O, well.

Review title: If your appalled by this movie..get over it..you should have known..this is the third one!!
Review_body: Some may say that this movie is ridiculous or disgusting because of its, bathroom humor, and the constant dirty, but sometimes vague references to something sexual.But haven't those people figured out by now that this movie is not for them? I mean there's been two movies before this and it isn't a surprise the kind of humor that is used in these movies. The Austin Power movies are about poking fun at things us as human beings do not discuss often and for that matter at all sometimes.Its about pushing the limits in comedy and showing people that hey this stuff can be funny if you think about it.Austin powers is hilarious,and I think that Goldmember was the best out of the three.Now don't get me wrong this movie had its flaws like all other movies do,but for what it is, I was really entertained by this and encourage those to see it.

First of all I have to admin I've first seen 2nd part of this trilogy than Goldmember and finally after plenty of viewing of this funniest movie ever made the first one. Well I have nothing to say but it's simply the best comedy ever made, from the first pre-caption scene through very best I don't know, who am I... Yes, I would like some chocolate asscream. Perhaps later... Prison rap and escape scene... MOLE... Shmoke and the pancake?... Toied like a toiger... I can't imagine what will come next from Mr. Myers but he has really huge challenge to beat this... I know every single line of script, am able to watch this every day (as far as Shrek 1+2, accidentally (?) another Myers-in movie :) Bravo! And for those who are grunting this: just try to watch this couple of times, you'll soon find the real beauty of this movie. It's spectacular. You'll be laughting your ass off, trust me. Just watch it with your friends with open minds!
